0.title: Apple unveils iPad with A14 chip, iPad Pro with M2 chip
0.article_body: Apple on Tuesday unveiled the next-generation iPad and iPad Pro. While both iPad and iPad Pro run on iPadOS 16, the iPad features an A14 Bionic chip with a 10.9-inch Liquid Retina display, an Ultra Wide 12 MP front camera and a 12MP back camera. The iPad Pro runs on an M2 Bionic chip and features a new Reference Mode.

1.title: Ancient Neanderthals were carnivores, ate bone marrow: Study
1.article_body: Researchers analysed the zinc isotopes from the tooth enamel of the remains of Neanderthals from the Gabasa site in Spain. It was found that the Neanderthals to whom the tooth enamel belonged were presumably carnivores who did not drink their prey's blood. Other chemical tracers revealed that they also ate the bone marrow of their victim without eating the bones.

2.title: President accepts Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam's resignation
2.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu has accepted Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam's resignation with immediate effect after he put down his papers following a row over his presence at a religious conversion event, the Home Ministry said. Delhi government had accepted Gautam's resignation and forwarded it to LG VK Saxena for approval, who had sent it for the President's approval last week.

3.title: Want to see Allu Arjun & Ram Charan in a film, have registered a title: Aravind
3.article_body: Film producer Allu Aravind, father of actor Allu Arjun, has said he wants his son and Ram Charan to do a film together. "I really want to make it happen and I have even registered the title Charan-Arjun and I keep renewing it every year," he added. "I'm sure that this project will happen in the coming days," said Aravind.

4.title: Stars give warnings before they die in supernova explosion: Study
4.article_body: Astronomers have created an "early warning" system that can alert when a massive star is about to die in a supernova explosion. They've found that before the star dies, a dense material suddenly accumulates around it, making it look 100 times fainter. "This means...the day before the star explodes, you likely wouldn't be able to see it," a researcher said.

5.title: 2 labourers die of suffocation while cleaning sewer in Guj's Surat
5.article_body: Two labourers died of suffocation while carrying out maintenance works in the manhole drainage chamber in the Sardar Vallabhbhai National Institute of Technology (SVNIT) campus in Gujarat's Surat on Tuesday. One more person is critical and is being treated at the government hospital. "If we find negligence on part of anyone, we will take strict legal action," police officials said.

6.title: Air India aims 30% domestic, international market share in 5yrs: CEO
6.article_body: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson on Tuesday said the airline aims to have 30% share in both domestic and international markets in the next five years. Wilson said the airline wants to restore its reputation, adding, "We've evidence to indicate that the progress is being made". Air India was taken over by Tata group in January 2022 for ₹18,000 crore.

7.title: Weightlifter Mirabai Chanu lifts actor Aparshakti Khurana, shares pics
7.article_body: Olympic medal-winning weightlifter Mirabai Chanu lifted actor Aparshakti Khurana at an event recently. Sharing pictures, she joked, "Hey @aparshakti_khurana sir let's do a complete CLEAN AND JERK the next time we meet." Reacting to her post, a fan wrote, "She did not put any real efforts into lifting him. That was so easy for her." Another wrote, "So effortless."

8.title: What are Canada's new rules to protect temporary foreign workers?
8.article_body: Canada has introduced new rules to strengthen protections offered to temporary foreign workers, including protecting them from any abuse, mistreatment or discrimination. Employers will be mandated to inform them about their rights in the country and provide them with health care services. Employers cannot charge recruitment fees to employees and will have to give them mandatory training.

9.title: 5 months of preparation was not enough for FIFA U-17 Women's WC: India coach
9.article_body: After India crashed out of the FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup, the team's head coach Thomas Dennerby said that five months of preparation was not enough to get ready for the tournament. "It is always painful to leave...in the group stage...[but] I am still proud of the girls because they were putting in the extra effort," Dennerby said.

10.title: Finance Ministry invites industry suggestions on taxes for 2023-24 Budget
10.article_body: The Finance Ministry has invited suggestions from industry and trade associations regarding direct and indirect taxes for the Union Budget for 2023-24. The ministry said that industry will be required to submit justification for their demands along with the suggestions. The ministry also sought industry suggestions on reducing compliance burdens, providing tax certainty and reducing litigation.

11.title: Indonesia to demolish football stadium where over 130 people died in stampede
11.article_body: Indonesia will demolish and rebuild the football stadium where over 130 people were killed in a stampede earlier this month. Indonesia President Joko Widodo said they will build Kanjuruhan Stadium in Malang according to FIFA standards. A fact-finding team formed by Indonesian government concluded that "excessive" and "indiscriminate" use of teargas by police was the leading cause of death.

12.title: Aryan case probe had irregularities, 7-8 officers behaved suspiciously: NCB inquiry
12.article_body: An NCB inquiry into the Aryan Khan drugs-on-cruise case has pointed out several "irregularities" in the case investigation, multiple reports said on Tuesday. A 3,000-page inquiry report also flagged "suspicious behaviour" of seven or eight officers of the agency who were on the case. An investigation was ordered despite a lack of evidence in the case, the inquiry reportedly found.

13.title: Indian women's junior 10m air pistol, rifle teams win golds at World C'ship
13.article_body: Indian women's junior 10m air pistol and rifle teams won gold medals at ISSF World Shooting Championship in Cairo on Tuesday. Esha Singh, Shikha Narwal and Varsha Singh beat China 16-6 in air pistol gold medal match, while Tilottama Sen, Nancy and Ramita beat China 16-2 in air rifle. India have won nine gold, three silver and eight bronze medals.

14.title: Kotak Investment Advisors looks to raise $1 billion: Report
14.article_body: Kotak Investment Advisors, backed by Uday Kotak, is looking to raise about $1 billion for a new fund for investing in India's residential real estate, according to reports. Abu Dhabi Investment Authority and Allianz SE could reportedly invest $500 million and $220 million in the fund, respectively. Kotak Investment is also in advanced talks with other investors for fundraising.

15.title: Manchester United charged by FA over players' reaction to Ronaldo's disallowed goal
15.article_body: Manchester United have been charged by the Football Association (FA) after their players surrounded referee Craig Pawson during Sunday's Premier League match against Newcastle. The players reacted angrily after Pawson disallowed a goal from Cristiano Ronaldo. United failed to ensure its players conducted themselves in an orderly fashion, the FA said.

16.title: Musk shares meme featuring him, Kanye & Trump with their social media apps
16.article_body: Elon Musk took to Twitter to share a meme featuring him, former US President Donald Trump and rapper Kanye West. The meme named the social media apps Parler and Truth Social, owned by Kanye and Trump, respectively. It also bore the alphabet 'X', a super app that Musk wants Twitter to transform into, once he buys the platform.

17.title: Efforts to end terrorism will continue till last breath: J&K LG
17.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Tuesday said, "Efforts to end terrorism in the whole of J&K will continue till the last breath, I assure." His remarks came after two labourers from UP were killed in a grenade attack by terrorists in Shopian. "Words cannot adequately condemn the barbaric terror attack," he had said on the killings.

18.title: 2 killed, 1 injured in knife attack in German city of Ludwigshafen
18.article_body: At least two people were stabbed to death and one person was severely injured during a knife attack in the western German city of Ludwigshafen on Tuesday, police said. The suspected attacker was shot and injured by the police before his arrest, as per media reports. The motive behind the attack was not immediately clear.

19.title: It'll further energise agri sector: PM as govt hikes MSP for 6 crops
19.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has said the hike in minimum support price (MSP) of several Rabi crops will further energise the agriculture sector. Notably, the government has approved an increase in MSPs for wheat by ₹110 to ₹2,125 per quintal and mustard by ₹400 to ₹5,450 per quintal for the current crop year. MSPs for barley and gram were also increased.

20.title: It glorified Telugu cinema beautifully: Rahman on Rajamouli's 'Baahubali'
20.article_body: AR Rahman, speaking about filmmaker SS Rajamouli, said, "When I saw Magadheera, I knew what this man can do." He added that his "jaw dropped" when he watched Rajamouli's 'Baahubali' for the first time. Rahman further said it "glorified Telugu cinema beautifully". The film featured Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Anushka Shetty, Tamannaah Bhatia and Sathyaraj, among others, in key roles.

21.title: Germany's cyber security head sacked over alleged Russian ties
21.article_body: Germany's national cyber security agency BSI's chief Arne Schonbohm was sacked from his post on Tuesday over his alleged links with people involved with Russian intelligence services. While confirming Schonbohm's dismissal, Berlin said the allegations had "permanently damaged" public confidence regarding his integrity. His links to a firm with ties to the Kremlin were highlighted by a comedian.

22.title: Please let's not be like her: Urfi on Jaya Bachchan telling media person 'Hope you fall'
22.article_body: Urfi Javed reacted to actress Jaya Bachchan's conversation with media photographers at Lakmé Fashion Week. Jaya is heard telling a photographer who took a tumble, "I hope you...fall." "Please let's not be like her, let's hope all of us only rise...People won't respect you because you're elder to them...or...powerful, they'll respect you if you're nice to them," wrote Urfi.

23.title: Police officer transferred after halting BJP corporator's event in Guj
23.article_body: A police officer was transferred from Manjalpur Police Station on Tuesday, a day after he stopped BJP corporator Kalpesh Patel from conducting a folk singing programme in Gujarat. A video showed Inspector Vijay Desai climbing on the stage at the venue and announcing that police had not given permission for the event. He also requested guests to leave the venue.

24.title: We're like Amar & Prem: 'Laal...' maker denies rumours of fallout with Aamir
24.article_body: 'Laal Singh Chaddha' director Advait Chandan has denied rumours of a fallout between him and Aamir Khan. Sharing a picture with Aamir on Instagram, Advait wrote, "For...those talking about...fallout between Aamir sir and me, I...want to say...we're like Genie and Aladin, Baloo and Mowgli, Amar and Prem." Aamir and Salman Khan played Amar and Prem respectively in 'Andaz Apna Apna'.

25.title: Belongings of 2 Arunachal mountaineers found 2 months after they went missing
25.article_body: The belongings of two mountaineers from Arunachal Pradesh, who have been missing since August 17, have been found by an independent search and rescue team on Monday, one of the mountaineer's family said. The team found tent, sleeping equipment, GPS and national and Arunachal Pradesh's flags. The mountaineers had gone missing while climbing Chiumo's peak close to the India-China border.

26.title: I feel ashamed as Indian: Kerala Guv on killings of Kashmiri Pandits
26.article_body: Reacting to the targeted killings of Kashmiri Pandits, Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan said he feels ashamed as an Indian. He added, "There can be no greater crime than...the killing of an innocent [person]." Khan further said, "If a single person from my country has to leave his home and become a refugee, no amount of shame will suffice it."

27.title: Police seizes 3,243 kg sacks of cannabis at Assam-Tripura border
27.article_body: Assam Police in Karimganj seized 3,243 kg of cannabis at the Assam-Tripura border check-post on Monday. Police said the contraband was packed in 93 jute bags and was being smuggled to Guwahati in a truck from the neighbouring state. "Another major feat by Assam Police in its drive against drugs...One accused has been apprehended," tweeted Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma.

28.title: 'No space left for talks': Zelenskyy as Russia targets power infra
28.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday said there was "no space left for negotiations" with his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin following the latest spate of Russian air strikes targeting Ukrainian energy and critical infrastructure. "Since Oct 10, 30% of Ukraine's power stations have been destroyed, causing massive blackouts across the country," Zelenskyy said in a tweet.

29.title: Puducherry to have medical college offering MBBS course in Tamil: Governor
29.article_body: Lieutenant Governor of Puducherry Tamilisai Soundararajan said that the government is planning to start a medical college offering the MBBS course in Tamil medium. She said she would also consult Chief Minister N Rangasamy to work out the logistics to open such a college. "A committee will be formed to prepare books in Tamil for medical education," she added.

30.title: Karnataka Congress launches 'Say CM' campaign against state govt
30.article_body: The Karnataka Congress launched a new campaign called 'SayCM' to talk about the alleged unfulfilled 2018 poll promises of the state's BJP government. "Answers should be given to the people...Should they pay 40% commission even to talk about their party's manifesto promises?" Congress tweeted. They also put a QR code that takes users to the '40% Sarkara' website.

31.title: 16-yr-old girl tries to sell her blood to buy smartphone in Bengal
31.article_body: A 16-year-old girl allegedly approached a blood bank in West Bengal on Monday to sell her blood so she could buy a smartphone. The blood bank authorities informed Childline India and the girl was counselled before being handed over to her parents. The girl told authorities that she had already ordered a smartphone worth ₹9,000 online.

32.title: Will work on reducing injuries to players, improving pitches: BCCI President Roger Binny
32.article_body: Newly-elected BCCI President Roger Binny said he'd primarily focus on reducing injuries to players and improving pitches in India. Roger said injury to Jasprit Bumrah just before T20 World Cup 2022 affected Team India's "whole plan". He added, "There needs to be more life in...wickets at home, so our teams wouldn't have the problem of adjusting when travelling abroad."

33.title: Jayalalithaa's legs weren't amputated, no slow poisoning: Inquiry Commission
33.article_body: There's no evidence to suggest that former Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa's legs were amputated while in hospital or that she was administered slow poison, according to Justice Arumughaswamy Commission's report. "This evidence is nothing but a mere surmise," the report said. It also rejected allegations that Jayalalithaa was assaulted on her head with a wooden log.

34.title: Haryana government hikes Dearness Allowance by 4% to 38%
34.article_body: Haryana government has hiked the Dearness Allowance (DA) of its employees drawing salaries as per the 7th Pay Commission by 4% to 38%. The increased DA will be paid with salaries of October 2022 while arrears for the July-September 2022 period will be paid in November 2022. The Centre had also hiked DA of its employees by 4% in September.

35.title: Something to cherish for lifetime: Jaffer on Meiyappan's hat-trick in T20 WC
35.article_body: Reacting to UAE spinner Karthik Meiyappan's hat-trick against Sri Lanka in T20 World Cup 2022, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "That's a quality hat-trick. Congratulations...Meiyappan, something to cherish for [a] lifetime." UAE skipper CP Rizwan said, "He bowled beautifully...He's a special bowler." The 22-year-old dismissed Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Charith Asalanka and captain Dasun Shanaka.

36.title: Police seize ₹19 lakh from Congress leader in Munugode, 1 arrested
36.article_body: Police on Tuesday arrested one person and seized ₹19 lakh from a vehicle on the outskirts of Telangana's Munugode Assembly constituency during a vehicle check on Wednesday. According to the police, the cash was found in a Maruti Brezza car on its way to the poll-bound Munugode. The car was reportedly owned by Congress politician C Rama Krishna Reddy.

37.title: Indian Defence sector will be a world leader in coming times: Rajnath
37.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said that Indian Defence sector will be a world leader in the coming times. Speaking at 'Manthan' ceremony in Gujarat, Singh said, "India is the youngest country in the world today, not only from a demographic point of view, but also from the mind." "Its thinking is new, its goals are new," he added.

38.title: ﻿Droom withdraws its initial public offering
38.article_body: A recent notification from the market regulator SEBI shows that automobile e-commerce company ﻿Droom has withdrawn its initial public offering. Droom had filed a draft red herring prospectus with SEBI to raise up to ₹3,000 crore. The proposed IPO included fresh issue of shares aggregating ₹2,000 crore and an offer for sale of shares aggregating ₹1,000 crore by Droom Pte.

39.title: Senior Chinese diplomat attacked Hong Kong protester, says UK MP; China responds
39.article_body: Senior Chinese diplomat Zheng Xiyuan was involved in attacking a Hong Kong pro-democracy protester outside the consulate in Manchester, a British MP alleged. The protester was allegedly pulled by the hair, dragged inside the consulate and beaten by the staff. China has responded to the allegations, saying the protesters 'illegally entered' the consulate and 'violated its peace and dignity'.

40.title: Stain on Modi govt's legacy: Cong on release of Bilkis case convicts
40.article_body: Congress on Tuesday accused the PM Narendra Modi-led central government of granting release to convicts in the Bilkis Bano case for political motives, adding that the stain on the government's legacy won't wash off. "It is repugnant, reprehensible and revolting that an elected government chose to release these convicts in such a cavalier manner," said Congress spokesperson Abhishek Singhvi.

41.title: Over 30,000 near-Earth asteroids have been discovered so far: ESA
41.article_body: According to the European Space Agency (ESA), over 30,000 near-Earth Asteroids (NEAs) have been discovered so far. NEAs are rocky bodies orbiting the Sun on a path that brings them close to Earth's orbit. They comprise one-third of around one million asteroids discovered in the solar system. Most of these NEAs live in the asteroid belt between Jupiter and Mars.

42.title: Govt should set moderate divestment targets: DIPAM Secretary
42.article_body: Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey said that the government should focus on privatisation of state-run companies instead of chasing high divestment targets. "We should actually have moderate targets and more focus should be on privatising," he said. Indian government has set a ₹650 billion divestment and privatisation target for 2022-23.

43.title: Adani Defence & Aerospace to acquire Air Works for ₹400 crore
43.article_body: Adani Group's wholly-owned subsidiary, Adani Defence & Aerospace, said it has signed definitive agreements to acquire Air Works for ₹400 crore. According to the statement, Air Works is India's oldest maintenance, repair and operations (MRO) organisation with six maintenance bays and over 900 maintenance experts. Indian MRO market is expected to grow three times by 2030, the company highlighted.

44.title: Pic of valid insurance policy of Ranveer Singh's ₹3.9 crore Aston Martin surfaces online
44.article_body: After a Twitter user claimed that Ranveer Singh was driving his ₹3.9 crore Aston Martin with expired insurance, it has now emerged that the car does have a valid insurance policy and the document has been shared online. The document shows the insurance was renewed as recently as this July. He was recently seen driving the vehicle at Mumbai airport.

45.title: Cyclone Sitrang likely to develop over Bay of Bengal around Oct 24
45.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday said the post-monsoon season's first cyclone is likely to develop over the Bay of Bengal around October 24. A low-pressure area is likely to develop by Thursday over southeast and adjoining east-central Bay of Bengal, the IMD added. Once it intensifies into a cyclone, it will be called 'Sitrang', as named by Thailand.

46.title: BJP wins all three seats in Zila Panchayat bypolls in Goa
46.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has won all three seats in the bypolls to Zila Panchayat constituencies in Goa, results of which were declared on Tuesday. BJP candidates Paresh Naik and Sandeep Kashinath Bandodkar won from Davorlim and Reis-Magos constituencies respectively while BJP-backed independent candidate Merciana Mendes E Vaz won from Cortalim constituency. Bandodkar won by 4,244 votes.

47.title: Mohanlal's 'Monster' banned in Gulf countries over LGBTQ content: Reports
47.article_body: Actor Mohanlal's upcoming Malayalam movie 'Monster' has reportedly been banned in the Gulf countries. As per reports, it was not cleared in the Gulf region as the censor board was not happy with the LGBTQ content in it. The makers have reportedly decided to re-submit the movie to the censor board after making necessary changes.

48.title: New Zealand's inflation stays near 32-year high at 7.2% in Q3
48.article_body: New Zealand's inflation remained near a 32-year high in the third quarter as annual inflation eased to 7.2% from 7.3% in the second quarter, Statistics New Zealand said on Tuesday. Consumer prices rose 2.2% in the last quarter. Earlier, New Zealand's Reserve Bank had predicted inflation would drop to 6.4%, while economists expected the rate to drop to 6.5%.

49.title: John Cena shares old pic of New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips on Instagram
49.article_body: Actor and WWE wrestler John Cena took to Instagram to share an old picture of New Zealand batter Glenn Phillips celebrating his T20I hundred against West Indies in 2020. His post comes amid T20 World Cup 2022 being held in Australia. Reacting to the picture, a fan wrote, "So...John Cena is the third umpire?" Another wrote, "Do you watch cricket?"

50.title: Education isn't business: Varun Gandhi on UP student crying over fees
50.article_body: BJP's Varun Gandhi on Tuesday shared a video of a girl who reportedly studies at a private school in UP's Unnao, crying as she was disallowed from taking an exam over non-payment of fees. "Private institutions, don't forget humanity. Education is not a business," Gandhi said, adding that the tears of the girl show the pain of lakhs of children.

51.title: Indians can see who allowed rapists to walk free: Moitra on Bilkis case
51.article_body: Reacting to the release of Bilkis Bano's rape convicts, TMC MP Mahua Moitra said, "Indians can see for the first time...who allowed rapists and killers to walk free prematurely." This comes after the Gujarat government disclosed that the central government had approved the release of the convicts. Moitra tweeted, "The CBI said NO...And yet Centre said YES to...'premature release' of...convicts."

52.title: Deeply saddened: Sunny Deol on Kedarnath helicopter crash
52.article_body: After a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashed in Uttarakhand, Sunny Deol tweeted, "Deeply saddened to hear about the Kedarnath helicopter tragedy. My heart goes out to the families of the pilgrims and the pilot. Om Shanti." Meanwhile, Sanjay Dutt wrote, "Sending my deepest condolences to the families of the people who lost their lives in the helicopter crash today."

53.title: Quoted judgments, facts missing: SC on Guj govt's reply in Bilkis Bano rape convicts' release
53.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday said Gujarat government's reply to pleas challenging release of 11 convicts in Bilkis Bano rape case has quoted a series of judgments but factual statements are missing. "A very bulky counter. Where is the factual statement, where is the application of mind?" the SC said. Pleas challenging convicts' release will next be heard on November 29.

54.title: IFS officer shares pic of a rare clouded leopard, says 'See the amazing patterns'
54.article_body: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Parveen Kaswan recently took to Twitter to share a picture of a clouded leopard, which he said was "one of the rare big cat species found in India". "Clouded leopards are beautiful creatures. See the amazing patterns," he tweeted. He also said that the species is very less studied and understood.

55.title: WI have what it takes to turn it around: Holder ahead of Zimbabwe game
55.article_body: Ahead of West Indies' Group B match against Zimbabwe in T20 World Cup 2022, West Indies all-rounder Jason Holder said his side has what it takes to turn it around following their "disappointing" performance against Scotland. "We obviously didn't bat well yesterday," he added. West Indies lost the match by 42 runs. They will face Zimbabwe on Wednesday.

56.title: About ₹95,000 cr to be invested in aviation sector in 4 yrs: Scindia
56.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has said the government and the private sector will make investments worth about ₹95,000 crore in India's civil aviation sector in next four years. The investments will reportedly be on development of greenfield and brownfield airports. This sector has passed through difficult times and it's now ready for take-off to its true potential, he added.

57.title: Amit Shah should resign: Siddaramaiah on release of Bilkis Bano case convicts
57.article_body: Congress leader Siddaramaiah demanded the resignation of Union Home Minister Amit Shah, saying his office ordered the release of convicts in the Bilkis Bano case. "The release of those inhuman rapists and murderers is to polarise electorate ahead of Gujarat elections," Siddaramaiah tweeted. "For BJP, elections become more important than the concerns of women of this country," he added.

58.title: J&K LG condemns killing of 2 UP labourers in grenade attack
58.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Tuesday denounced the killing of two labourers from Uttar Pradesh in a grenade attack by terrorists in Shopian. "Words cannot adequately condemn the barbaric terror attack on Manish Kumar and Ram Sagar from Kannauj, Uttar Pradesh," LG's office said in a statement. "We've intensified...efforts to crush terrorists and terror ecosystem," it stated.

59.title: Ethiopian army captures 3 towns from rebel forces in Tigray region
59.article_body: Ethiopia's national army has seized control of three towns from regional forces in the rebel-held Tigray province, the federal government said on Tuesday. "The (army) has taken control of...Shire, Alamata, and Korem....," the government stated. The Tigray conflict is a result of rivalries between regional power blocs and disagreement over power sharing between federal and regional authorities.

60.title: Pakistani drone shot by BSF at Punjab border; 3rd incident in 4 days
60.article_body: A Pakistani drone, found to be ferrying 2.5 kgs of narcotics, was shot down by the Border Security Force (BSF) along the International Border in Punjab's Amritsar, an official said on Tuesday. "A bullet hit the drone, due to which it fell to the ground," a BSF spokesperson said. This is the third such incident in the past four days.

61.title: Extremely sad: UP CM condoles loss of lives in Kedarnath helicopter crash
61.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath condoled the loss of lives in a helicopter crash near Uttarakhand's Kedarnath Dham on Tuesday, calling the incident "extremely sad". "May Prabhu Shri Ram grant a place to the departed souls at his feet. My condolences are with the bereaved families," he said. Seven people, including the pilot, were killed in the accident, officials said.

62.title: Nothing has materialised on acquisition of dr Gerard as yet: Parle
62.article_body: Biscuit maker Parle Products' Senior Category Head B Krishna Rao on Tuesday said though there was discussion some time back regarding acquisition of Polish biscuit and cookies firm dr Gerard, "nothing has materialised as yet". Reports had earlier claimed that Parle is in talks with private equity firm Bridgepoint for dr Gerard's acquisition. Bridgepoint had bought dr Gerard in 2013.

63.title: 1 child/minute being admitted for malnutrition treatment in Somalia: UNICEF
63.article_body: One child is being admitted to a health facility for the treatment of "severe acute malnutrition" every minute in Somalia, a UNICEF spokesperson said on Tuesday. This comes as Somalia faces a drought that threatens to cause the deaths of children on a scale that the UNICEF official said has not been witnessed "in half a century".

64.title: PM should undergo lie detector test & say CBI, ED independent: AAP
64.article_body: BJP should ask PM Narendra Modi to undergo a lie detector test and say the CBI and the ED are independent and have nothing to do with the party, AAP said on Tuesday. The comments came after BJP's Kapil Mishra asked Manish Sisodia to take a lie detector test over his claim that the CBI asked him to quit AAP.

65.title: Delhi Police seize over 2,000 kg firecrackers; 6 arrested
65.article_body: Delhi Police arrested six people in four separate operations and seized over 2,000 kg of firecrackers. The accused were identified as Kapil (27), Shanky (33), Suresh (59), Rakesh (40), Sagar (27) and Sanjay (53). Notably, three operations were carried out by police teams of Dwarka, North East and South Delhi districts, and one other was conducted by the narcotics squad.

66.title: Mumbai-based hotelier's family gets daughter-in-law booked for theft
66.article_body: A Mumbai-based hotelier's family has accused their daughter-in-law of stealing jewellery worth ₹18 lakh from her marital home. The mother-in-law of the woman approached the Bandra Metropolitan Magistrate court after which a case was registered. Incidentally, the accused had filed a complaint with the Khar Police in 2021 in which she had accused her husband of sexual abuse and harassment.

67.title: Haryana govt to open 40 urban health centres in Gurugram
67.article_body: The Haryana government will soon open 40 urban health centres in Gurugram city, said Gurugram Deputy Commissioner Nishant Kumar Yadav. The new wellness centres will ease the burden on the existing medical facilities, he said. "Each centre will have facilities to carry out 14 types of tests and offer 12 types of medical services to patients," he said.

68.title: Unsure if potholes resulted in B'luru woman being run over: BBMP
68.article_body: The BBMP reportedly said it has not yet been determined whether potholes led to the death of the Bengaluru woman who fell from her scooter and was mowed down by a bus. "It won't be possible to determine...the cause...until reports from the...police teams are in," said Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath. The traffic police said they'll file a report soon.

69.title: 5 teens drown in river during picnic in MP; CM announces ex-gratia
69.article_body: Five boys, aged between 13 and 15, drowned in a river during a picnic on Monday in Madhya Pradesh's Katni district, police said on Tuesday. "[My] heart is filled with immense pain due to the untimely demise of innocent children," CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan tweeted. Katni Collector said the deceased's families will each receive an ex-gratia payment of ₹4 lakh.

70.title: Delhi recorded 314 new dengue cases in the past week
70.article_body: Delhi registered 314 dengue cases in the past week, which is seven cases fewer than last week's tally. In the week before, 321 dengue cases were reported. According to the Municipal Corporation Department, 635 dengue cases were reported this month till October 12. In total, 1,572 cases have been reported this year in the city so far.

71.title: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar gifts director Om Raut Ferrari supercar worth ₹4.02 crore
71.article_body: T-Series head Bhushan Kumar, who is bankrolling the upcoming epic drama 'Adipurush', has gifted the film's director Om Raut a supercar. According to reports, Kumar has gifted Raut the Ferrari F8 Tributo, which is priced at ₹4.02 crore. Reports also suggest that the car is not straight out of the showroom, but instead, it was earlier registered in Kumar's name.

72.title: How do the T20 World Cup 2022 points tables read?
72.article_body: After Day 3 of T20 World Cup 2022, Netherlands are on top of the first round Group A table, with two wins. Meanwhile, Namibia are second and Sri Lanka are third with a win each. Scotland and Zimbabwe lead Group B table, followed by Ireland and West Indies. Top two teams from each group will advance to Super 12 stage.

73.title: Delhi man cheats people of ₹8 cr via fake franchise deals, arrested
73.article_body: Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing has arrested a man for allegedly cheating people of ₹8 crore on the pretext of making them associates in a cargo business, officials said on Tuesday. The accused presented himself as the Executive Director of Bhagwati Airways Express Ltd. and signed franchise agreements with the complainants to make them business associates, police said.

74.title: Meta accepts UK's order to sell Giphy
74.article_body: Facebook parent Meta has agreed to sell the GIF creation platform, Giphy, two years after acquiring it in a reported $400 million deal. This comes after the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) ordered Meta to sell Giphy on Tuesday after its view that the acquisition reduced innovation in the advertising market. "We are disappointed by the decision," Meta said.

75.title: 77,000 consumers face power outage due to heavy rains in Pune
75.article_body: At least 77,000 consumers faced power outages as supply to several housing societies in Pune was disrupted because of heavy rains on Monday evening, officials said. Technical staff and engineers of the Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited worked throughout night and day to restore phase-wise supply. In some areas, the supply was restored by morning, a spokesperson said.

76.title: 2017 champion Kidambi Srikanth enters pre-quarterfinal of Denmark Open
76.article_body: Former champion Kidambi Srikanth entered the pre-quarterfinal of Denmark Open on Tuesday. The Indian shuttler defeated world number 14 Ng Ka Long Angus 17-21, 21-14, 21-12 in the first round. World number 11 Srikanth, who won the tournament in 2017, will now face Loh Kean Yew. The seventh seed beat Thailand's Sitthikom Thammasin 21-13, 22-20.

77.title: Japan to impose additional sanctions against North Korea
77.article_body: Japan will impose additional sanctions on North Korea by freezing the assets of groups involved in its missile development programme, a Japanese official said on Tuesday. He stated, "We cannot tolerate North Korea's repeated provocative actions...." This comes following a string of recent ballistic missile tests carried out by Pyongyang, including the one where a projectile was fired over Japan.

78.title: Kriti Sanon shares her first look from horror-comedy film 'Bhediya'
78.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon on Tuesday unveiled her first look from the upcoming horror-comedy film 'Bhediya'. "Meet Dr. Anika! Bhediya ki doctor!" she wrote while sharing the look on her Instagram handle. Praising her look, Ayushmann Khurrana wrote in the comments section, "Too cool!" Directed by Amar Kaushik, 'Bhediya' also stars Varun Dhawan.

79.title: Mumbai to have AC local train with fibre-reinforced polymer seats by Oct end
79.article_body: Western Railway's Mumbai Division is all set to have the newly inducted air-conditioned (AC) local train with modular fibre-reinforced polymer (FRP) seats by the end of October. It comprises four types of coaches with a combined carrying capacity of 1,118 passengers. It'll also have one coach equipped with flexi-solar panels that will power the fans and lights of the coach.

80.title: 5 people arrested for murder of priest, his son in Hyderabad's Uppal
80.article_body: Five people have been arrested for their alleged involvement in the murder of a 75-year-old priest named Narsimha and his 45-year-old son in Hyderabad's Uppal on Friday. Police said the main accused, Likki Vinay Yogendar Reddy, suspected Narsimha of performing black magic on him to avoid repaying him ₹6 lakh. Reddy had given Narsimha ₹6 lakh for performing a puja.

81.title: Rhea Chakraborty danced with inmates on her last day in jail: Sudha Bharadwaj
81.article_body: Activist Sudha Bharadwaj revealed that actress Rhea Chakraborty, who was arrested in a drugs case related to Sushant Singh Rajput's death, danced with inmates on her last day in jail. "When she left, she'd some money remaining in her account, so for all...barracks she asked for sweets to be given,"  added Sudha, who was lodged in the same jail.

82.title: Delhi Transport Dept denies vehicle to disabled girl, DCW sends notice
82.article_body: The Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) has issued a notice to the city government's Transport Department, over the alleged refusal by a dealer to sell a commercial vehicle to a specially-abled girl for personal use. The girl has requested approval for her to purchase the vehicle, which is spacious enough to accommodate her motorised wheelchair, as there's no alternative available.

83.title: Done as per law: Pralhad Joshi on release of Bilkis Bano rape convicts
83.article_body: Reacting to the release of 11 men convicted in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case, Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister Pralhad Joshi said, "I do not find anything wrong in that because it is done as per the process of law." His remarks came after the Gujarat government told the Supreme Court that the convicts were released on grounds of "good behaviour".

84.title: Never nice to be on losing side: Erasmus after Namibia's loss vs Netherlands
84.article_body: Following Namibia's five-wicket loss against Netherlands in T20 World Cup 2022 Group A match, Namibia skipper Gerhard Erasmus said, "Never nice to be on...losing side when it's so close." He added, "We put a good show in the field. With...bat, it seemed difficult for both sides but they ran better than us." Netherlands chased the 122-run target in 19.3 overs.

85.title: There can be no safe havens for terrorists, drug cartels: PM Modi
85.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said there can be no safe havens for the corrupt, terrorists, drug cartels, poaching gangs and organised crime. He said, "When the threats are global, the response cannot be just local." He said a safe and secure world is "our shared responsibility", adding, "When the forces of good cooperate, the forces of crime can't operate."

86.title: Lulu Group to invest ₹3,000 crore to build India’s biggest mall at Ahmedabad
86.article_body: Lulu Group Director of Marketing and Communications V Nandakumar said it was planning to invest  ₹3,000 crore to set up India’s biggest shopping mall at Ahmedabad. He said the construction of the mall will begin early next year. The mall, which would have all modern facilities, would give direct and indirect employment to 6,000 and 12,000 people, respectively.

87.title: 3-yr-old washed away after falling into uncovered drain in Bengaluru
87.article_body: A three-year-old boy from Bengaluru's Varthur area has been reportedly washed away after he fell into an uncovered stormwater drain 100 metres from his home. The boy was playing with five other children when he fell inside. About 25 emergency services members are working to find the boy but heavy run-off from the recent rains is hampering rescue operations.

88.title: No merit in Umar Khalid's bail plea, it's dismissed: Delhi HC
88.article_body: The Delhi High Court denied bail to former JNU student Umar Khalid in the case related to an alleged conspiracy behind the Northeast Delhi riots in February 2020. "There is no merit in the bail appeal. Bail appeal is dismissed," said the bench. Khalid, who was arrested in September 2020, sought bail stating he had no role in the violence.

89.title: 'Powerful explosions' damaged Nord Stream gas pipelines: Denmark
89.article_body: Danish authorities on Tuesday confirmed that the Nord Stream 1 and 2 gas pipelines in the Baltic Sea have suffered "extensive damage", saying it was caused by "powerful explosions". Earlier this month, Sweden said its probe into the ruptures detected on the pipelines has "strengthened the suspicions of serious sabotage". Four leaks have been detected on the pipelines so far.

90.title: Anguished: PM after 7 people killed in Kedarnath helicopter crash
90.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said he is anguished by the helicopter crash in Uttarakhand. "In this tragic hour, my thoughts are with the bereaved families," PM Modi added. Seven people, including two pilots, were killed after a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims from Uttarakhand's Phata crashed on Tuesday. Meanwhile, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Dhami has ordered an investigation into the incident.

91.title: Railways, road corporation seek nod to fell 1,000 trees in B'luru
91.article_body: The forest cell of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) received two proposals from the South Western Railway (SWR) and Karnataka Road Development Corporation Limited (KRDCL) on October 17, seeking permission to fell nearly 1,000 trees. Citizens have been requested to file their objections regarding the projects for which the trees are proposed to be felled by October 27.

92.title: BEST to run extra buses in Mumbai, Suburbs & Navi Mumbai for Diwali
92.article_body: On the occasion of Diwali, BEST will run extra buses on prominent routes in Mumbai, Suburbs and Navi Mumbai between October 22 and October 26. The additional bus services will cover routes, including Dadar Plaza, Kalbadevi, Bandra, Mahatma Jyotiba Phule Market in Mumbai and APMC Market in Navi Mumbai. Moreover, 140 extra buses will run on Bhai Dooj (October 26).

93.title: Bride seeks groom from only specific 'Tier-1' colleges; matrimony ad goes viral
93.article_body: A matrimony advertisement went viral after a bride sought a groom from only specific colleges that she ranked as 'Tier-1', adding that he must be earning at least ₹30 LPA. Several Twitter users reacted to the ad, with one saying, "They're being honest...They have the right to do so." Another user tweeted, "I thought it was a job posting."

94.title: PM to virtually attend 'grih pravesh' of 4.5 lakh PMAY beneficiaries in MP
94.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will virtually participate in 'grih pravesh' of 4.50 lakh beneficiaries of Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) on Dhanteras (October 22) in Madhya Pradesh, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said. The main event will be held at BTI Ground, Satna. An official said 51,000 masons were trained for the construction of PMAY houses. 'Grih pravesh' is a house-warming ceremony.

95.title: Introduce 'Amar Chitra Katha' for entrepreneurship in school: Hurun India MD
95.article_body: Hurun India Founder and MD Anas Rahman Junaid said comic-like books around entrepreneurship and business must be introduced at school level in India to create children's interest in the subject at an early age. "It'll be interesting if someone can put together...something like an Amar Chitra Katha. That should do wonders," Junaid said. "Creating wealth is an art," he added.

96.title: Locals protest as stray dog mauls 7-month-old boy to death in Noida
96.article_body: Several people protested outside a housing society in Noida after a seven-month-old boy was mauled to death by a stray dog. The baby was reportedly admitted to ICU after his intestines were pulled out in the attack, however, he couldn't be saved. Meanwhile, a senior Noida Authority official said, "We're coordinating with...societies and dog shelters to check...menace of dog bites."

97.title: Man stabs estranged wife 13 times, hospitalised after suicide bid in B'luru
97.article_body: A 30-year-old man reportedly killed his 25-year-old estranged wife by stabbing her 13 times in Bengaluru. He later tried to take his own life and was hospitalised with injuries to his stomach and throat. The accused reportedly suspected his wife of having an affair. They married seven years ago and had been living separately for two years.

98.title: Disturbing elements illegally entered the Manchester consulate: China
98.article_body: After a pro-democracy Hong Kong protester was allegedly assaulted inside the Chinese consulate in Manchester, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Wang Wenbin said that "disturbing elements" had illegally entered the consulate. Wang Wenbin declined to confirm or deny whether China's Consul General in Manchester was involved in the incident. British police launched an investigation into the case.

99.title: Man beats brother to death with frying pan in Ghaziabad; arrested
99.article_body: A man allegedly beat his brother to death with a frying pan on Sunday in Ghaziabad. Both the brothers, who have been identified as Bablu Kumar and Arjun Kumar, were reportedly drunk at the time of the incident. An argument reportedly broke out between them when Bablu was beating his wife over suspicion of having an extra-marital affair with Arjun.

100.title: It's now about winning 3rd game: Edwards on Netherlands' win vs Namibia
100.article_body: After Netherlands won their second consecutive Group A match in T20 World Cup 2022 against Namibia, Netherlands skipper Scott Edwards said that it's now about winning the third match to secure Super 12 qualification for his side. Netherlands defeated Namibia by five wickets. With four points from two matches, Netherlands are currently at the top of Group A standings.

101.title: Windows failed to protect users against malicious drivers: Report
101.article_body: Microsoft failed to protect millions of Windows users against malicious drivers as it didn't update the list of affected drivers in nearly three years, according to a report by Ars Technica. Exploiting the vulnerability, cybercriminals can take control of users' devices using a technique called 'BYOVD'. "Microsoft is...aware of BYOVD threat and has been working on defences," the report said.

102.title: Constable asks MP man to remove tinted glass from SUV windows, beaten
102.article_body: A man allegedly thrashed a traffic constable in Madhya Pradesh's Indore when the latter asked him to remove tinted glass from his car windows and pay a fine for violating rules on Monday. The 31-year-old SUV owner then hit his own head with a stone when he saw other police personnel approaching him, police said. The accused was arrested.

103.title: Byju’s standalone business posted loss in FY21 with 30% revenue drop
103.article_body: Edtech startup Byju's standalone business, comprising K-12 (kindergarten to class 12) offerings, posted a loss of ₹2,702.14 crore for FY21 against a profit of ₹7.39 crore in FY20 with revenues falling over 30% during the year, the company's recent filings with the Ministry of Corporate Affairs showed. Revenue from operations fell to ₹1,378.51 crore from ₹1,918.25 crore a year earlier.

104.title: Thane man seeking refund of ₹299 loses ₹49,000 to cyber fraud
104.article_body: A 54-year-old Kalyan resident seeking a refund of ₹299 for a failed mobile phone recharge was allegedly cheated of ₹49,950 in a cyber fraud. The victim received a call from a fraudster who offered to help him and sent a phishing link and induced him to share his bank account details and siphoned money from his account, police said.

105.title: UAE record lowest total of T20 World Cup 2022
105.article_body: UAE on Tuesday were dismissed for 73 runs in 17.1 overs by Sri Lanka in their T20 World Cup 2022 Round 1 match. It's the lowest total in T20 World Cup 2022. UAE's Aayan Afzal Khan, the youngest cricketer to feature in T20 World Cup aged 16, top-scored with 19(21). Meanwhile, eight of 11 UAE batters scored in single digits.

106.title: Tamil Nadu Assembly adopts resolution against imposition of Hindi
106.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government moved a resolution against Hindi imposition in the state Assembly. "This House expresses concern that the recommendations of the Parliamentary Committee...are against the two-language policy resolution moved and passed by Perarignar Anna...This House urges the Union government not to implement the recommendations made in the report," said the resolution.

107.title: Cong has again proved internal democracy: CEA on party's chief poll
107.article_body: Congress Central Election Authority (CEA) Chairman Madhusudan Mistry on Monday said the party has "once again proved what internal democracy is and other parties can take lessons from it". His statement came while addressing a press conference after the conclusion of voting for the Congress Presidential election. "By and large, 96% voting took place across states," Mistry stated.

108.title: Corruption-free administration needed for sustainable development: Kerala CM
108.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan on Tuesday said a corruption-free administrative system is necessary for sustainable development of a country and it is with this view the state government is functioning. "That's why Kerala has the honour of being the state with the least corruption in India," Vijayan said. In future, we would be able to eradicate it completely, Vijayan added.

109.title: India's Nutakki expelled from World Junior Chess C'ship for having earbuds in pocket
109.article_body: Indian Woman Grandmaster (WGM) Priyanka Nutakki has been expelled from World Junior Chess Championship being held in Italy for having earbuds in her jacket pocket. Saying that there is no indication of foul play on her part, FIDE stated that earbuds are "strictly forbidden" in playing hall. The point scored by Nutakki in sixth round was awarded to her opponent.

110.title: UAE's Junaid Siddique smashes biggest six of T20 World Cup 2022
110.article_body: UAE's number 10 batter Junaid Siddique smashed a 109-metre maximum on the bowling of Sri Lanka fast bowler Dushmantha Chameera during their T20 World Cup 2022 Round 1 match on Tuesday. It is the biggest six of T20 World Cup 2022. Notably, it was the only six of UAE's innings against Sri Lanka.

111.title: Harrison Ford joins MCU, to play 'Thunderbolt' Ross in Captain America 4
111.article_body: Veteran American actor Harrison Ford has joined the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and will be seen in 'Captain America: New World Order', the fourth instalment in the 'Captain America' franchise. Harrison has replaced William Hurt to portray Thaddeus 'Thunderbolt' Ross. William passed away in March this year. The film is expected to release in 2024.

112.title: Indonesia to demolish football stadium where stampede killed 133
112.article_body: Indonesian President Joko Widodo has said that the football stadium where a stampede killed 133 people will be torn down and rebuilt according to FIFA standards. The new stadium will have "proper facilities that can ensure the safety of...players and supporters", he added. The stampede on October 1 happened after police tear-gassed fans who invaded the pitch after a defeat.

113.title: Amit Shah expresses grief over loss of lives in Kedarnath helicopter crash
113.article_body: After a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashed in Uttarakhand, Union Home Minister Amit Shah expressed grief over the incident. "The incident of the crash…is very saddening," Shah tweeted. "I express my condolences to the families of all those who lost their lives in this accident. May God give them the strength to bear this grief," Shah added.

114.title: Man files complaint about bad road, meets with accident on same road in B'luru
114.article_body: On October 6, a 66-year-old man moved a complaint to BBMP, stating the road from BEL Circle to Peenya Metro Station was in a bad condition. On Wednesday, he met with an accident on the same road while trying to avoid a pothole. Following the accident, the BBMP chief said redevelopment work of the stretch would be taken up soon.

115.title: 23 children killed in mass protests in Iran: UN rights office
115.article_body: At least 23 children have been killed in the protests in Iran, a UN human rights office spokesperson said. Children have been killed due to live ammunition, metal pellets at close range and fatal beatings. An unspecified number of children had been arrested during school raids, the rights office added. Protests were triggered after the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini.

116.title: Boman didn't have dates, I convinced him to do 'Uunchai': Anupam
116.article_body: Anupam Kher revealed that he had to convince Boman Irani to do 'Uunchai'. "When I asked Sooraj (Barjatya, director) about the cast, he said there's a nice role for Boman, but he doesn't have dates and has some personal commitments...So I called him later and convinced him to do the film," he said. The film will release on November 11.

117.title: Be responsible and choose appropriate words: Delhi court to Tejashwi
117.article_body: A Delhi court suggested Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav to be responsible and choose appropriate words while speaking in public. "You have to understand the implications of your words. This should not happen again," said the court. The court also refused to cancel the bail granted to him in the alleged Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) scam case.

118.title: Delhi to get 100 electric vehicle charging stations in 2 months: CM
118.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said the city would get 100 electric vehicle charging stations in the next two months. Kejriwal inaugurated 11 charging stations on Tuesday and said the facilities would also include battery swapping points. These 11 stations have 73 charging points, he added. The Delhi Electric Vehicles policy was introduced in 2020.

119.title: Mumbai Police return lost bag to owner with ₹2 lakh cash in 2 hours
119.article_body: Mumbai Police on Sunday traced and returned a bag with ₹2 lakh cash within two hours after the owner forgot the bag in an auto-rickshaw. According to police, the complainant and his brother boarded an auto from outside Borivali East railway station to purchase a second-hand taxi. "In a hurry...they forgot the bag with cash in the auto," police added.

120.title: 2 Naxalites surrender before security forces in Chhattisgarh's Sukma
120.article_body: Two Naxalites surrendered before the security forces in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district, police said on Tuesday. The surrendered Naxalites, identified as Ganga and Deva, were residents of Gadiras area and were a part of the Dandakaranya Adivasi Kisan Majdoor Sangthan (DAKMS), an official said. Ganga was carrying a reward of ₹1 lakh on his head, the official added.

121.title: Indian Railways to run 211 special trains amid festive season
121.article_body: The Indian Railways has announced 211 special trains across country amid festive season, the Railways announced on Tuesday. The trains will cover a total of 2,561 trips till Chhath Puja this year, the railways added. The trains will connect major destinations throughout the country such as Darbhanga, Azamgarh, Saharsa, Bhagalpur, Muzaffarpur, Firozpur, Patna, Katihar, and Amritsar, among others.

122.title: Pak official doesn't reply when asked 'will you handover Dawood to India?'; video out
122.article_body: Pakistan's chief of the Federal Investigation Agency (FIA) Mohsin Butt was on Tuesday asked by a reporter, "Will this process of extradition with India move forward? Will you handover Dawood Ibrahim to India?" A video of Butt's reaction showed him looking away from the reporter and refusing to answer his question. The video was taken during Interpol conference in Delhi.

123.title: Annexed Ukrainian regions protected by nuclear weapons: Russia
123.article_body: Russia on Tuesday said that the four Ukrainian regions annexed last month are under the protection of its nuclear arsenal. "All these territories [Donetsk, Luhansk, Kherson and Zaporizhzhia] are inalienable parts of Russia," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. Russian President Vladimir Putin has warned that Russia will use nuclear weapons if its "territorial integrity" is threatened.

124.title: Tech Mahindra signs MoU with Guj; to hire 3,000 employees in 5 yrs
124.article_body: Tech Mahindra has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Gujarat government under the latter's Employment Generation Incentive and the 'Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Sahay Yojana'. The IT giant plans to hire over 3,000 professionals in Gujarat over the next five years. Tech Mahindra's MoU is one among the 15 MoUs signed by Gujarat government with domestic and global IT companies.

125.title: No comparison with Lord Ram: Patole on Minister’s remark on Rahul
125.article_body: Responding to Rajasthan Minister Parsadi Lal Meena's comment, which likened Rahul Gandhi to Lord Ram, Congress' Nana Patole said that it's a coincidence that Rahul Gandhi and Lord Ram have an 'R' in their name. Rahul is covering even more distance than Lord Ram by walking from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir, Meena had earlier said.

126.title: Ambuja Cement raises ₹5,000 crore through Adani's family firm
126.article_body: Ambuja Cement on Tuesday said it has issued 47.74 crore warrants at a price band of ₹418.87 to Adani family firm Harmonia Trade and Investment and raised ₹5,000 crore. The warrants, issued on preferential basis to Harmonia, have a face value of ₹2. Harmonia Trade and Investment has until now paid ₹104.72/warrant, which is around 25% of the issue price.

127.title: AAP to build schools at every 4 km in 8 Guj cities if voted to power: Sisodia
127.article_body: If AAP is voted to power in Gujarat, it will build a government school at every four kilometres in eight cities within a year, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said on Tuesday. "The people of Gujarat are determined to get schools made for their children and will elect a party that builds schools," Sisodia added.

128.title: 12 She mobile electric toilets rolled out in 6 GHMC zones
128.article_body: As part of the central government's Safe City initiative, 12 She mobile electric toilets have been rolled out for women in six Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) zones. The restrooms are available in Secunderabad, LB Nagar, Khairatabad, Charminar, Serilingampally and Kukatpally. In Hyderabad Commissionerate, facilities will be stationed at places like Dharna Chowk and Pragathi Bhavan.

129.title: Mini-bus rams into autorickshaw on way to school in Thane, 3 hurt
129.article_body: Three children travelling in an autorickshaw to school sustained injuries when a mini-bus crashed into their vehicle and dragged it for some distance in Thane. The injured children, class 2 students, were taken to a hospital for treatment. The autorickshaw driver said he jammed the brakes of the autorickshaw and ensured that the children didn't sustain any major injury.

130.title: Russia denies using Iranian drones in attack on Ukraine
130.article_body: The Kremlin on Tuesday denied that its forces had used Iranian drones to attack Ukraine, saying that Russian equipment with Russian nomenclature was used. Ukraine accused Russia of using Iranian Shahed-136 "kamikaze" drones, which explode on impact, to carry out attacks in Kyiv. Iran has denied supplying drones to Russia, however, the US State Department accused Iran of lying.

131.title: 'Scam 1992' fame Pratik Gandhi buys Mercedes car worth ₹1.16 crore, pics surface
131.article_body: Actor Pratik Gandhi, who played the role of Harshad Mehta in 'Scam 1992', bought a Mercedes-Benz GLS 450 which is worth around ₹1.16 crore. As per reports, the actor purchased the car on the occasion of Dussehra. Pratik was recently seen in 'Kahani Rubberband Ki', which was released on October 14.

132.title: Singer Chinmayi shares pic of her baby bump, rubbishes surrogacy rumours
132.article_body: Singer Chinmayi Sripaada, who welcomed twins in June, took to Instagram to share a picture of her baby bump. "The only selfie I took throughout pregnancy. The only. Here at almost 32 weeks," she captioned the picture. In a video, the 38-year-old rubbished rumours about her babies born via surrogacy and revealed that she had her twins after a miscarriage.

133.title: Suspect uploads morphed video of Gurugram girl on Insta reels; case filed
133.article_body: An unidentified person was booked for allegedly uploading a morphed video of a Gurugram-based girl on social media. The suspect made an Instagram reel in which a minor's face was added to a pornographic video and then the video link was sent to her father, the police said. The act seemed to be an attempt to defame her, police added.

134.title: Tata Communications' Q2 net profit rises by 25% to ₹532 crore
134.article_body: Tata Communications on Tuesday reported a 25.1% surge in its consolidated net profit for the September quarter at ₹532 crore from ₹425 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Its revenue from operations was ₹4,431 crore, a 6.2% increase as against ₹4,174 crore in the same quarter last year. Data business revenues were at ₹3,493 crore, a 4.6% increase quarter-on-quarter.

135.title: Ather Energy raises ₹400.6 crore in Caladium Investment-led round
135.article_body: Electric vehicle maker Ather Energy has secured ₹400.6 crore in a funding round led by Caladium Investment which invested ₹400 crore, according to Registrar of Companies' filings. The funding round also saw participation from Herald Square Ventures which pumped in ₹64 lakh. In May 2022, the startup had raised around ₹991 crore in a Series E funding round.

136.title: UP principal locks girl in room, chops her hair for coming to school with 1 braid
136.article_body: A school principal in Uttar Pradesh's Farrukhabad was booked for allegedly locking up a girl student in a room and chopping off her hair against her will. The girl alleged that the principal had made it a rule that all the girls have to come to school with two braids. She was 'punished' as she had made only one braid.

137.title: Case filed over morphed video of minor in Gurugram
137.article_body: Gurugram Police booked an unidentified suspect for allegedly uploading a morphed video of a girl on social media. The accused made an Instagram reel in which the minor's face was added to a pornographic video and then the video was sent to her father, police said. The FIR was lodged under section 67A of the Information Technology Act.

138.title: Akshay set himself on fire in 'Waqt...', I asked 'What're you doing?': Big B
138.article_body: Talking about Akshay Kumar during an episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14', actor Amitabh Bachchan said, "Akshay jumps from one building to another. In 'Waqt: The Race Against Time', he set himself on fire." "I keep asking him, 'What're you doing?', and he responds that [the stunt] will be done," added Amitabh. "Akshay does [the stunts] well also," he stated.

139.title: He's a nice man: Azharuddin on Binny's appointment as new BCCI President
139.article_body: Commenting on Roger Binny's appointment as the new BCCI President, replacing Sourav Ganguly, ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin said, "He (Binny) is a nice man." He added, "I have played a lot of cricket with him and we have fond memories." Former India cricketer Binny was appointed as the 36th President of BCCI on Tuesday.

140.title: Cognizant rolls out salary hikes for employees after Wipro & TCS
140.article_body: IT company Cognizant has begun rolling out annual salary hikes for its employees, reportedly ranged between 7% to 10%. This comes after Wipro, TCS and Infosys rolled out hikes recently. Last week, Cognizant told its employees that "formal eLetters" with new compensation would be out through the week and the hike would take effect for levels up to associate director.

141.title: A transforming, different experience for me: Ishaan on 'Pippa'
141.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter said his upcoming film 'Pippa' has certainly been "a transforming, different experience" for him. "It is in that kind of zone that is not being explored by young actors," Ishaan added. In 'Pippa', Ishaan will be seen playing Brigadier Balram Singh Mehta, who fought on the eastern front during the Indo-Pakistan War of 1971.

142.title: Liverpool are still a great team: Ex-forward Sadio Mane
142.article_body: Ex-Liverpool forward Sadio Mane has said Liverpool played with a great mindset against Manchester City to claim their third Premier League win of the season on Sunday. "It shows that they still are a great team. Liverpool will always be Liverpool," he added. Liverpool beat defending champions Manchester City 1-0 at Anfield. Mane joined Bayern Munich in June this year.

143.title: Challenge him to say he's ready for narco test: Mishra on Sisodia's CBI claim
143.article_body: After Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said that he was asked to leave the Aam Aadmi Party inside the CBI office, BJP leader Kapil Mishra said that he challenges him to apologise by 5 pm today. "I challenge him to either apologise or face media...and say he's ready for a lie detector test and narco test," he added.

144.title: On suspicion of theft, man threatens to drop boy in well in MP
144.article_body: A case has been filed after a man held a boy in a well by the hand and threatened to drop him on the suspicion that he stole a phone in Madhya Pradesh's Chhatarpur, police said on Tuesday. A teenager, who recorded a video of the incident, informed the boy's parents. Video purportedly shows the boy dangling in the well.

145.title: President Murmu condoles loss of lives in Kedarnath helicopter crash
145.article_body: After a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashed in Uttarakhand, President Droupadi Murmu on Tuesday condoled the loss of lives in the incident. Seven people, including a pilot, have been killed in the incident, officials said. "My deepest condolences to the families who lost their loved ones," President Murmu tweeted. PM Narendra Modi also expressed grief over the incident.

146.title: Man sets ablaze 5 family members including 2 stepchildren in Punjab
146.article_body: As many as five members of a family, including two children, were allegedly burnt to death by their 30-year-old stepfather at a village in Punjab's Jalandhar, police said. The accused, a daily wager, mixed petrol and diesel, and sprayed on the victims before setting them ablaze, police added. Among the deceased were his wife and her parents.

147.title: 2 tourists killed, 3 injured in hot air balloon mishap in Turkey
147.article_body: A hot air balloon carrying 28 passengers and two crew members made a hard landing in Turkey's Cappadocia on Tuesday, killing two Spanish tourists and injuring three others from Spain, the local governor's office said. An unexpected increase in wind speed has been identified as the cause of the accident, according to initial assessments, the governor said in a statement.

148.title: Electronics Mart India shares rise 10% after Nippon India MF buys stake
148.article_body: Electronics Mart India's stock locked in the 10% upper circuit at ₹92.95/share on NSE on Tuesday, a day after Nippon India Mutual Fund bought an additional 0.6% of its equity stake at an average price of ₹89.42 apiece. In the previous session, which was the first trading day for the stock after IPO, its shares closed at a 43% gain.

149.title: My dream is to cover distance between Delhi & Mumbai's Nariman Point in 12 hrs: Gadkari
149.article_body: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said it was his "dream" to connect Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link directly with Mumbai-Delhi Express Highway. He added, "My dream is also to connect Nariman Point (in Mumbai) with Delhi and cover the entire distance in 12 hours." The first phase of the Delhi-Mumbai expressway will be completed this year, he said.

150.title: 15-year-old boy trying to enter Gurugram society for fair assaulted by guards
150.article_body: A 15-year-old boy who had come to see a Diwali fair organised in a housing society in Sector 49 of Gurugram was allegedly abused, kicked and beaten up with sticks by the guards, police said on Monday. Police added that an FIR has been registered in the case. The boy was reportedly stopped at the gate of the society.

151.title: Stop wasting time levying fines during Diwali period: Patil to Pune Police
151.article_body: Maharashtra minister and BJP leader Chandrakant Patil on Monday told Pune Police to counsel commuters instead of imposing fines on them. "It is the Diwali period ahead and police should stop wasting their time [levying] fines...So orders are being issued to not waste time in giving challans to traffic violators in order to curtail traffic jams," Patil said.

152.title: 32-year-old Mumbai man cheated of over ₹3 lakh by cyber fraudster
152.article_body: A 32-year-old man was cheated of over ₹3 lakh by a fake recruiter online on the pretext of securing a well-paying job in Mumbai. He received a call purportedly from the HR department of a reputed airline and was induced by a woman to transfer the amount to the bank account number provided by her.

153.title: Students made to stand under sun all day for not paying school fee in UP's Unnao
153.article_body: Some students who were not able to pay school fees were made to stand under the sun all day in Uttar Pradesh. The incident took place in Bal Vidya Mandir in Unnao district. In a video that reportedly went viral, a student said she has already told her family about the fee and her father was going to pay it.

154.title: Big B is the easiest actor I've worked with: 'Uunchai' director Sooraj
154.article_body: 'Uunchai' director Sooraj Barjatya said that Amitabh Bachchan has been "the easiest actor" he's worked with. "Spending time with him off the set in the van was ever special because he would talk about poetry and filmmaking," he added. Amitabh Bachchan said it was an honour for him to work in 'Uunchai', which also features Anupam Kher and Boman Irani.

155.title: Death toll in Russian warplane crash rises to 13
155.article_body: At least 13 people, including three children, have been killed after a Russian warplane Su-34 bomber crashed into a residential area in Russian city of Yeysk after suffering engine failure. Three people died after they jumped from upper floors of a nine-storey apartment building to escape a blaze, a Russian news agency reported. Nineteen injured people have been hospitalised.

156.title: 2 of 3 siblings abducted from Rajasthan found dead in Delhi; accused arrested
156.article_body: Rajasthan Police has arrested two men accused of abducting three brothers from Rajasthan's Alwar and found the bodies of two boys, aged 13 and eight, in Delhi, a day after the accused demanded ₹8 lakh ransom. The third sibling, aged seven, has been taken to a children's home. The accused had killed the two boys after they started crying.

157.title: Quick 20 in T20 WC warm-up match vs NZ will make Pant automatic pick: Gavaskar
157.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar said Rishabh Pant will become an "automatic pick" in India's lineup for T20 World Cup if he scores a quick 20 in the warm-up match against New Zealand at the Gabba. Gavaskar added Pant will be happy to play at the Gabba, having helped India end Australia's 32-year unbeaten streak in Test cricket at the ground in 2021.

158.title: Don't think Smith will be a part of playing XI for T20 WC match vs NZ: Bailey
158.article_body: Australia's Chairman of Selectors George Bailey said he doesn't think former Australia captain Steve Smith will be a part of the playing XI for Australia's opening match of the T20 World Cup 2022 against New Zealand. "Should we need a role from Smith at some stage, then absolutely," added Bailey. Australia were recently defeated by India in a warm-up match.

159.title: Scindia urges 8 states to reduce VAT on ATF to increase air connectivity
159.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has urged eight states, including West Bengal, Delhi and Punjab, to reduce VAT on aviation turbine fuel (ATF) to facilitate air connectivity to tier-2 and tier-3 cities. He said that there were 12 states that had far-sighted views on the issue and they lowered VAT on ATF many months ago.

160.title: 30-year-old woman, lover kill her husband in Ludhiana; arrested
160.article_body: A 30-year-old woman, along with her lover, allegedly murdered her husband in Ludhiana's Phullanwal village. They were arrested on Monday. The accused tried to make it look like a road accident death and took the victim to a hospital. Later, they confessed to their crime. The accused attacked the victim with an iron rod, a police official said.

161.title: Nuclear threat more useful to Russia than nuclear strike: Norway
161.article_body: Norway's armed forces chief said that the West should listen carefully when Russian President Vladimir Putin talks about using nuclear weapons but should remember that it's more useful for Putin to threaten their use than to go ahead. "It's about deterrence...It's about making sure that it [Russia] has the capability...that it can do it," General Eirik Kristoffersen added.

162.title: Microsoft fires around 1,000 employees across several divisions: Report
162.article_body:
Microsoft has fired around 1,000 employees across several divisions this week, as per Axios. The job cuts affected less than 1% of Microsoft's total workforce of around 2,21,000 as of June 30.
Microsoft in a statement said,  "Like all companies, we evaluate our business priorities on a regular basis, and make structural adjustments accordingly."

163.title: Sri Lanka's Nissanka falls over and loses shoe while hitting four, video goes viral
163.article_body: Sri Lanka opener Pathum Nissanka fell over and lost his shoe while hitting a scoop shot for a boundary during his team's T20 World Cup 2022 match against UAE. Reacting to a video of the shot shared by ICC, a fan wrote, "Should be called 'shoe off shot'." Another fan joked, "That's how I enter my room."

164.title: BMW & other cars get washed away amid rain in Pune, videos surface
164.article_body: Amid heavy rainfall in Pune, people have shared videos and pictures of the rain-battered city on social media. Some videos showed cars getting washed away in rainwater, while one video showed a BMW 5 series car being held on a submerged road in Pune on Monday. As per IMD, Monday was the third wettest October day in Pune since 2011.

165.title: Maha minister orders reconstruction, repair of 400 km of Pune roads
165.article_body: Maharashtra minister Chandrakant Patil has ordered the reconstruction and repair of 400 kilometres of roads in Pune city. "The rains played havoc with the lives of citizens, resulting in bad roads and traffic jams across the city," he said. "Private traffic wardens will be stationed for traffic management, and roads under the Pune metro bridges will be repaired," Patil added.

166.title: Hair-straightening chemicals linked with uterine cancer risk: Study
166.article_body: Hair-straightening chemicals may significantly increase the risk of developing uterine cancer among those who use them frequently, according to a study by the US' National Institutes of Health. For the study, researchers tracked 33,497 racially diverse women aged between 35 and 74 for an average of nearly 11 years. During that time, 378 uterine cancer cases were diagnosed.

167.title: Hope to make cars for Tesla one day: Foxconn Chairman Liu Young-way
167.article_body: As it ramps up electric vehicle manufacturing, Foxconn says it wants to replicate its level of success in assembling consumer gadgets. Chairman Liu Young-way said, "Hope one day we can do Tesla cars for Tesla," adding, "Ambitions-wise, hopefully we're able to achieve the same kind of achievement like in ICT industry, but we'll start small...which is about 5% in 2025".

168.title: My father was a neo-Nazi, yelled 'don't be a f*****' at me: Spacey in sex abuse trial
168.article_body: Actor Kevin Spacey has denied the sex abuse claims levelled against him by actor Anthony Rapp, who alleged Spacey tried to have sex with him when he was 14. He further defended himself for coming out as gay after the abuse allegations. "My father was a white supremacist and neo-Nazi...He would scream at me: 'Don't be a f*****'," said Spacey.

169.title: UAE's 22-yr-old Meiyappan becomes 1st bowler to take a hat-trick in T20 World Cup 2022
169.article_body: UAE's 22-year-old leg-spinner Karthik Meiyappan on Tuesday became the first bowler to take a hat-trick in T20 World Cup 2022. Meiyappan dismissed Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Charith Asalanka and Dasun Shanaka in three consecutive deliveries in Sri Lanka's 15th over. Meiyappan is the fifth bowler to take a hat-trick in T20 World Cup history.

170.title: Salman wanted to do 'Uunchai', I said no: Director Sooraj Barjatya
170.article_body: Director Sooraj Barjatya said Salman Khan wanted to star in his upcoming film 'Uunchai', but he refused to cast him. "I said no because I wanted a different cast," Sooraj said. Salman and Sooraj Barjatya previously collaborated for many films, including 'Maine Pyar Kiya' and 'Hum Aapke Hain Koun'. Talking about Salman, Sooraj said the actor is his "best friend".

171.title: NIA conducts raids at 2 places in Patna in connection with PFI case
171.article_body: The NIA conducted raids at two locations in Patna's Phulwari Sharif in connection with the alleged terror module linked to the PFI. A search operation has been launched at the residence of Margub Ahmed, alias Danish. He was allegedly running a WhatsApp group called Ghazwa-e-Hind, a suspected terror organisation. Earlier, the NIA conducted raids in Darbhanga, Madhubani, among other districts.

172.title: Water taxi connecting Navi Mumbai to South Mumbai in 15 mins launched
172.article_body: Mumbai Port Trust has launched a water taxi service between Belapur to the Gateway of India and Uran that will reduce the travel time between Navi Mumbai and South Mumbai to 15 minutes. The 65-seater water taxi between Belapur and Uran, and the 200-seater taxi between Belapur and Gateway of India will charge ₹300 and ₹400 for one way, respectively.

173.title: PMC issues emergency helpline numbers amid heavy rains in Pune
173.article_body: Amid heavy rains in Pune, the municipal corporation has issued emergency helpline numbers for the residents for flood-related issues. Citizens can contact the civic authorities at 02022506800. For police, fire and ambulance services, citizens can dial 100, 101 and 108, respectively. For drinking water emergencies, citizens can contact the water supply department at 020-25501383 or 02066344203.
