174.title: Won't call Shami perfect replacement of Bumrah in India's T20 WC squad: Raina
174.article_body: Speaking about Mohammad Shami replacing Jasprit Bumrah in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, Suresh Raina stated he wouldn't call the 32-year-old pacer a perfect replacement because Bumrah or Ravindra Jadeja cannot be replaced. "They've played consistently for India," he added. Shami took three wickets in the final over of India's six run-win over Australia in the warm-up match.

175.title: Pune hospital superintendent, peon booked for accepting bribes
175.article_body: The medical superintendent and peon of a sub-district hospital in Pune's Daund were booked for allegedly demanding and accepting bribes from a man seeking a duplicate marriage certificate as the original had got misplaced. While the medical superintendent sought a ₹3,000 bribe, the peon demanded a ₹2,000 bribe from the man, according to a press release.

176.title: Irani man tries to extort ₹40 lakh from businesswoman in Pune; arrested
176.article_body: A 31-year-old Irani national, leader of the Irani group in Pune, has been arrested for allegedly trying to extort ₹40 lakh from businesswoman Sapana Morarjee. The accused, identified as Farzad Mohamad Riza Fakhabadi, had demanded the money to withdraw a case filed by an Irani girl against Sapana's son. The girl had accused him of threatening and illegally detaining her.

177.title: Belarus to hold live-fire drills & launch anti-aircraft missiles with Russia
177.article_body: The Belarusian Defence Ministry has said that it will conduct live-fire exercises and launch anti-aircraft guided missiles as a part of joint grouping with Russian forces, a Russian news agency reported. This comes after Belarus accused Ukraine of preparing to attack its territory. Before invasion, Russia stationed its troops in Belarus before launching cross-border attacks into Ukraine.

178.title: Supreme Court lawyer collapses during hearing, judges rush to assist
178.article_body: A lawyer collapsed in the Supreme Court on Tuesday morning while arguing a case. As per a report by Bar and Bench, Justice BR Gavai and Justice BV Nagarathna rushed from their seats to assist the lawyer following the incident. A doctor was called to the court to check on the advocate, the report added.

179.title: B'luru sees wettest year in history by beating 2017 record: Report
179.article_body: With 1,704 mm of rainfall recorded in 2022, Bengaluru has broken the record for the highest annual rainfall in history, according to data from the IMD. The previous record was made in 2017, reports said. Bengaluru also recorded the wettest April in seven years, the coolest day of May in ten years and the wettest June in a decade.

180.title: Dharmendra and I used to play cards while travelling to 'Sholay' sets: Big B
180.article_body: Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan, recalling the shoot of his 1975 film 'Sholay', revealed that he used to play rummy with Dharmendra while travelling to the film's set. "Dharmendra ji and I used to travel by...same car and it took us around 45-50 minutes to reach the sets from the hotel. We used to sit together and play cards," he said.

181.title: Cong’s Bharat Jodo Yatra bigger than Lord Ram’s padyatra: Raj minister
181.article_body: Rajasthan Health Minister Parsadi Lal Meena called Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra a "unique and historic" movement while adding that Rahul Gandhi’s march is much bigger than Lord Ram’s padyatra from Ayodhya to Sri Lanka. "Lord Ram had also travelled on foot from Ayodhya to Sri Lanka but now Rahul Gandhi will walk even more, from Kanyakumari to Kashmir," Meena added.

182.title: PM Modi with rapists: Rahul on release of Bilkis Bano case convicts
182.article_body: A day after the Gujarat government disclosed that the Centre approved the release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano rape case, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that PM Narendra Modi "supports rapists". "He talks about women's respect from Red Fort, but in reality, he is with the rapists," he said, adding that PM has only cheated women.

183.title: ₹1 crore cash seized from BJP corporator's car in Telangana
183.article_body: Telangana's Nalgonda Police seized ₹1 crore in cash from a BJP corporator's car during a vehicle-checking drive, as per a police statement. At the time of the seizure, the corporator's husband was in the driver's seat, police added. The money was being transported by the husband from Vijayawada on the instructions of former MP G Vivek Venkatswamy, police stated.

184.title: Exxon fully exits Russia after assets worth $4 billion seized
184.article_body: ExxonMobil on Monday said it has completely withdrawn from Russia after the government expropriated its assets. The US oil company, which had valued its Russian assets at over $4 billion, owned 30% stake in oil project Sakhalin-1. "Russian government has unilaterally terminated our interests in Sakhalin-1 and the project has been transferred to a Russian operator," an ExxonMobil spokeswoman said.

185.title: Govt increases MSP on wheat by ₹110, mustard by ₹400
185.article_body: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs (CCEA) has approved an increase in MSPs for wheat by ₹110 to ₹2,125 per quintal and mustard by ₹400 to ₹5,450 per quintal for the current crop year. The MSPs for barley, gram, masoor, rapeseed and safflower was also increased. Currently, the government fixes MSPs for 23 crops.

186.title: YouTube ends trial that made 4K videos exclusive to Premium users
186.article_body: YouTube has ended a trial wherein some users were asked to become Premium subscribers to watch videos in 4K resolution. "We've fully turned off this experiment. Viewers should now be able to access 4K quality resolutions without Premium membership," a Twitter account of YouTube said. YouTube had launched the trial to know "the feature preferences of Premium and non-Premium viewers".

187.title: Man dies after being knocked down by tanker in Mumbai; driver arrested
187.article_body: A man died after he was hit by a tanker in Chembur, Mumbai on Monday. The 50-year-old deceased was walking with his wife before he was hit and died on the spot, police said. The accused tanker driver attempted to flee but was caught by locals and later got arrested. He has been booked under IPC sections 279 and 304-A.

188.title: UAE summons EU mission head over Borrell's racist 'jungle' remark
188.article_body: The UAE on Monday summoned the acting head of the mission at the European Union delegation to the UAE over EU foreign policy chief Josep Borrell's "inappropriate and discriminatory" comments. In his remarks at the new European Diplomatic Academy in Belgium last week, Borrell called Europe "a garden" and most of the world a "jungle" that "could invade the garden".

189.title: ONGC Videsh plans to retake 20% stake in Russia's Sakhalin-1: Report
189.article_body: According to reports, ONGC Videsh Limited (OVL), the overseas arm of state-owned ONGC, is making a proposal to retake 20 per cent stake in Russia's Sakhalin-1 oil and gas project. Vladimir Putin had transferred the project and all of its assets and equipment to a new operator after disbanding Exxon Neftegaz as operator of the Sakhalin-1.

190.title: Russia fines Amazon 4 mn roubles for not deleting illegal content: Report
190.article_body: A Russian court on Tuesday fined US-based e-commerce firm Amazon 4 million roubles (about $65,000) in two separate cases, Interfax reported. The court ruled that Amazon had failed to delete material relating to drug use and "propagandising suicide", both of which are illegal under Russian law. This is the first fine Amazon has faced in Russia.

191.title: #Punerains trends as city reports 3rd wettest Oct day since 2011
191.article_body: #Punerains started trending on Twitter as heavy rains continued to lash several areas of the city, leading to waterlogging and traffic congestion on roads. Pune city recorded 104.5 mm of rain in the 12 hours between 8.30 pm Monday and 8.30 am Tuesday. According to India Meteorological Department (IMD) data, this was the third wettest October day since 2011.

192.title: Cowardly act: Dy CM after 2 UP labourers killed in grenade attack in J&K
192.article_body: UP Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak condemned the incident where two labourers from UP were killed after terrorists lobbed a hand grenade in J&K’s Shopian. "Very unfortunate...Government is working to eliminate terrorists...Won't tolerate this cowardly act," Pathak said. Under PM Narendra Modi's leadership, work to uproot Pakistan-sponsored terrorism from India is being done, he stated.

193.title: Hasty response: Israel as Aus reverses recognition of Jerusalem as capital
193.article_body: Israeli PM Yair Lapid on Tuesday criticised Australian PM Anthony Albanese's government's decision to stop recognising west Jerusalem as his country's capital, reversing a 2018 decision by the previous government. Lapid described the move as a "hasty response". "We can only hope that the Australian government manages other matters more seriously and professionally," he added.

194.title: We will add donate option to Starlink: Elon Musk
194.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has said the company "will add a donate option to Starlink". His remark came in response to a tweet by CEO of a fintech firm who said he'd like to donate Starlink's satellite internet service to schools and hospitals in Uganda. Musk then tweeted, "Are there others [who] want to donate Starlinks to places in need?"

195.title: Who are the new office-bearers of BCCI?
195.article_body: Roger Binny was elected as the new BCCI President during the board's 91st Annual General Meeting (AGM) held on October 18. Jay Shah has been elected the Secretary of the board for the second time in a row, while Rajeev Shukla remains the Vice President. Devajit Saikia and Ashish Shelar have been elected as Joint Secretary and Treasurer, respectively.

196.title: Sewage overflow near Hyd's Jahangir Peer Dargah causing inconvenience: Locals
196.article_body: Sewage overflow and bad road condition was reported near Hyderabad's Jahangir Peer Dargah. The local people said that the government and the concerned authorities in the Wakf Board are not paying attention to the difficulties being faced by them and pilgrims. Jahangir Peer Dargah is a 720-year-old shrine located in Inmulnarva village of Kothur Mandal in Ranga Reddy district.

197.title: What are the Kamikaze drones being used in the Russia-Ukraine war?
197.article_body: Kamikaze drones, which detonate on impact, destroying them in the process, have reportedly been used by both Russia and Ukraine in the ongoing conflict. The drones, which Ukraine and US say have been made in Iran, are also known as Shahed-136 drones and are made to hit specific targets with explosives. They loiter over their targets until instructed to attack.

198.title: 51-year-old man dies while performing dandiya raas in Gujarat; video surfaces
198.article_body: A 51-year-old man died while performing dandiya raas with sticks at a function at a relative's place in Gujarat's Dahod district. A video showed the man collapsing while performing raas, following which his relatives rush to his aid. He was rushed for treatment but was declared dead.

199.title: Didn't have clue she'd take such a drastic step: Vaishali Takkar's mother
199.article_body: Vaishali Takkar's mother said she didn't know that the television actress "would take such a drastic step" of ending her life. She said the accused, Rahul Navlani, was "adamant about making attempts" to get Vaishali's wedding called off, which was supposed to happen in December. "Vaishali has written that she'll get justice only after Rahul will be punished," she added.

200.title: Mumbai's oldest captive lion Ravindra dies at 17 due to age-related issues
200.article_body: The oldest captive male lion in Mumbai, Ravindra, died due to age-related issues on Monday. "He was under the medical supervision of the vet committee," Clement Ben, Additional Principal Chief Conservator of Forest (APCCF) Wildlife West, said. Reports said that Ravindra was brought to Sanjay Gandhi National Park from Bannerghatta Zoo on September 21, 2009, at the age of four.

201.title: Moscow has not notified about expected nuclear drills: US official
201.article_body: A US military official has said Russia has not yet notified about exercises of its nuclear forces that Washington expects Moscow to carry out. The US had said that Russia is likely to test launch missiles during annual "Grom" exercises of strategic nuclear forces. Russia is obliged to notify of missile launches under the New START Treaty, US official said.

202.title: Ranveer Singh accused of driving ₹3.9 cr car with expired insurance; Mumbai Police reacts
202.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has been accused by a Twitter user of driving his ₹3.9 crore Aston Martin with expired insurance. The Twitter user shared photos of Ranveer's car and insurance details and asked Mumbai Police to take action in the case. Meanwhile, Mumbai Police replied, "We have informed the traffic branch."

203.title: My goal this year is to grab a catch which could be one of my best catches: Hardik
203.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya has said that his goal this year is to grab a catch which could be one of the best catches of his career. "I was always natural as a fielder, but I want to be exceptional. Now, I am able to spend some time on my skills and get those difficult catches," he said.

204.title: Cong chief poll sees 96% turnout, no adverse incident reported: CEA
204.article_body: Congress Central Election Authority (CEA) Chairman Madhusudan Mistry said about 9,500 of the total around 9,900 electors cast their votes in the Congress Presidential poll held on Monday. The overall voter turnout was 96% and in small states, it was nearly 100%, he added. "In all states where polling booths were set up, no adverse incident was reported," he stated.

205.title: India will not travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023: Jay Shah
205.article_body: BCCI Secretary Jay Shah on Tuesday said that India will not travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023. The BCCI will demand that the tournament be moved to a neutral venue, with Shah saying, "Neutral venue for Asia Cup is not unprecedented." The decision to not travel to Pakistan was taken at the BCCI's Annual General Meeting today.

206.title: UK should use local laws to deal with assault of HK protester: Lee
206.article_body: Hong Kong leader John Lee said the case of a pro-democracy Hong Kong protester allegedly assaulted inside the Chinese consulate in Manchester should be dealt with in accordance with local laws. British police launched an investigation after the man was filmed being dragged inside consulate and beaten by several men during a demonstration against Chinese President Xi Jinping on Sunday.

207.title: SDRF teams on spot, detailed inquiry ordered: U'khand CM on Kedarnath helicopter crash
207.article_body: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami expressed condolences over the helicopter crash at Garud Chatti near Kedarnath. Seven people died in the incident. "SDRF & district administration teams have reached the spot for relief and rescue work. A detailed inquiry has been ordered into this tragic incident," state Chief Minister tweeted.

208.title: Ram Charan, wife Upasana head to Japan for 'RRR' promotions, pic surfaces
208.article_body: Actor Ram Charan has left for Japan to promote SS Rajamouli’s ‘RRR’ ahead of its release in the country on October 21. A picture of Ram with his wife Upasana Konidela and their dog Rhyme has surfaced on internet, which is being widely shared by his fans. The actor will also be joined by his ‘RRR’ co-star Jr NTR.

209.title: Had gone to Pak to perform a play, we were caught with alcohol: Sumeet
209.article_body: Actor Sumeet Vyas said he once went to Pakistan to perform a play, having crossed the Wagah border on foot. "[We were]...told...that...[we shouldn't] carry alcohol because it is not allowed...But as luck would have it, somebody [carried it]," added Sumeet. Sumeet stated that Pakistan's immigration officers were able to detect the presence of alcohol resulting in it being confiscated.

210.title: Centre in denial mode on Global Hunger Index ranking: Chidambaram
210.article_body: Former Finance Minister P Chidambaram alleged that the Centre was in a denial mode about the Global Hunger Index ranking. "The first task of any government is to overcome the challenges of poverty, hunger and malnutrition...The report released on 17-10-2022 has confirmed that 27.39 crore were lifted out of poverty in the 10 years of the UPA government," said Chidambaram.

211.title: 1st phase of Delhi-Mumbai Expressway to be completed this year: Gadkari
211.article_body: Speaking on the status of the Delhi-Mumbai Expressway, Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari claimed that work on the first phase from Delhi to JNPT in Mumbai would be completed this year itself. "My plan is to connect Nariman Point to Delhi making it a 12-hour journey," said Gadkari. The expressway will be approximately 1,350 km long.

212.title: Sachin Tendulkar names his semi-finalists for T20 World Cup 2022
212.article_body: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar named the teams which according to him would feature in the semi-finals of T20 World Cup 2022. The 49-year-old stated that Australia and England could reach the semi-finals from Super 12 stage's Group 1, while India and Pakistan are likely to advance from Group 2. "I would obviously want India to be the champions," he stated.

213.title: Who won what at 2022 Ballon d'Or awards ceremony?
213.article_body: At 2022 Ballon d'Or awards ceremony, Barcelona's 18-year-old Gavi won Kopa trophy for the best under-21 player. Barcelona's Robert Lewandowski won the Best Striker of the Year award. The Yashin Trophy for the best goalkeeper was awarded to Real Madrid's Thibaut Courtois. Men's Ballon d'Or award was won by Karim Benzema, while Barcelona’s Alexia Putellas won women's Ballon d'Or award.

214.title: 6 killed, 15 injured after bus rams into trailer in Gujarat's Vadodara
214.article_body: As many as six persons were killed and nearly 15 others were injured after a bus rammed into a trailer on the Ahmedabad-Mumbai national highway in Gujarat's Vadodara on Tuesday, police said. The bus was going towards Surat from Rajasthan, police added. The accident happened when it tried to overtake the trailer on a bridge on the highway, police stated.

215.title: Extremely unfortunate: Jyotiraditya Scindia on Kedarnath helicopter crash
215.article_body: Reacting to the helicopter crash incident in Uttarakhand, Union Minister for Civil Aviation Jyotiraditya Scindia said that it is an "extremely unfortunate" incident and he was in touch with the state government to ascertain the magnitude of the loss. Six people, including two pilots, were killed after a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims from Uttarakhand's Phata crashed on Tuesday morning.

216.title: Stones hurled at police who went to raid Ghaziabad godown; 2 hurt
216.article_body: Two police personnel were injured after stones were hurled at a police team who reached a village in Ghaziabad to raid a godown allegedly used to store illegal firecrackers worth over ₹80 lakh, officials said on Monday. The police team went to the village for the raid based on a tip-off. Fourteen people were arrested, the Circle Officer (City) said.

217.title: Anti-Semitic & insulting: White House on Trump's comments on US Jews
217.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's comments that American Jews have offered insufficient praise for his policies toward Israel were "insulting" and "anti-Semitic", White House said. "No President has done more for Israel than I have," Trump said on Truth Social. While in office, Trump moved the US Embassy to Jerusalem and recognised Israeli sovereignty over the Golan Heights.

218.title: Suzlon Energy's shares rise after bagging Adani Green Energy order
218.article_body: Suzlon Energy's shares surged on Tuesday after the renewable energy solutions provider said it has secured an order from Adani Green Energy to develop a 48.3 MW wind power project in Gujarat. This is a repeat order from Adani Green, in addition to the existing 226.8 MW order. Suzlon Energy's stock was trading 4.70% higher at 12:53 pm on NSE.

219.title: UP govt hikes DA for employees, pensioners to 38% ahead of Diwali
219.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has increased the Dearness Allowance (DA) and Dearness Relief for employees and pensioners to 38% ahead of Diwali, CM Yogi Adityanath tweeted on Monday. The state government will also give a bonus of ₹6,908 to all its employees for the financial year 2021-22, he said. The hiked DA will be effective from July 1, 2022.

220.title: China speeding up plans for unification with Taiwan: US
220.article_body: China is pursuing unification with Taiwan "on a much faster timeline" than previously expected, US State Secretary Antony Blinken said. If Beijing cannot achieve unification by peaceful means it would use "coercive means" and "maybe forceful means", he added. Blinken reiterated that the US would honour its commitments to Taiwan and support the island's ability to defend itself.

221.title: Bodies of pregnant woman, husband found hugging each other after drone attack in Ukraine
221.article_body: The bodies of a 34-year-old pregnant woman and her husband were found in an embrace after a drone attack on an apartment block in Ukraine's Kyiv recently, her colleagues said. She was six months pregnant, they added. "Vladimir Putin can score another 'conquest', he killed another pregnant woman," Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

222.title: I say 'Sorry for hitting, hit me later if you wish': Big B on action scenes
222.article_body: Discussing the bond that he shares with actors who play villains in his movies, actor Amitabh Bachchan said, "When there are action scenes...[I]...apologise saying, 'I'll have to hit you, forgive me. You may hit me later'." Talking about his film 'Sholay', Amitabh stated, "Dharmendra and I used to travel [in] the same car...We used to sit together and play cards."

223.title: 66% Indian CEOs predict recession to hit in next 1 year: KPMG survey
223.article_body: About 66% CEOs in India expect a recession to hit over next one year and 86% predict it will impact company earnings by up to 10%, according to KPMG 2022 India CEO Outlook. The survey revealed that 58% leaders in India expect a recession to be short and mild. About 62% CEOs in India said recession will upend anticipated growth.

224.title: Hope they do well: Maanvi Gagroo on 'Tripling 3' & 'Four More…' clash
224.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo said she's hoping that the third season of her upcoming shows 'Tripling' and 'Four More Shots Please!', releasing on October 21, "do extremely well". Talking about having two releases on the same day, Maanvi said she reminds herself to be grateful as it's not something that happens with many actors. "I'm just soaking it in," she added.

225.title: Shot for Radha song, there were 100+ dancers: Sidharth on 'Student...' 1st day
225.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra said that he shot for the song 'Radha' on his first day of shooting for 'Student Of The Year'. "I was very nervous. It was very overwhelming...to be...choreographed by Farah Khan. There were some hundred plus dancers, Manish Malhotra doing our clothes and [we were] getting our hair and make-up fixed amid shaadi ka setting," Sidharth added.

226.title: Will there be new dawn?: Sibal after Justice Chandrachud appointed as next CJI
226.article_body: After Justice DY Chandrachud was appointed the 50th CJI, senior lawyer Kapil Sibal tweeted, "Will there be new dawn when Justice Chandrachud takes over?" Furthermore, he said, "DY Chandrachud next CJI…Not surprised anymore at what this government does: Granting remission to rapists-murderers." "Not surprised...by what the court does: Stays acquittal in a special hearing on a Saturday," he tweeted.

227.title: Roger Binny appointed as new BCCI President
227.article_body: Roger Binny has been appointed as the new BCCI President, replacing Sourav Ganguly. This comes as the BCCI held its Annual General Meeting (AGM) at the Taj Hotel in Mumbai. Earlier, reports said that Ganguly was offered the post of IPL Chairman, however, he declined it. Reports also said that BCCI won't back Ganguly for the post of ICC Chairman.

228.title: Wipro signs 5-yr deal with Finland-based stainless steel firm Outokumpu
228.article_body: Wipro announced a five-year deal with Finland-based stainless steel manufacturer Outokumpu to boost the latter's cloud transformation for applications. As part of the deal, Wipro will help Outokumpu become a sustainability-focused organisation. Outokumpu is known for tailoring stainless steel into any form or for any purpose. Wipro's stock was trading 1.77% higher at 11:54 am on NSE on Tuesday.

229.title: Commission probing Jayalalithaa's death orders inquiry against Sasikala, doctor
229.article_body: The report of Justice Arumughaswamy Commission, which probed the death of former Tamil Nadu CM J Jayalalithaa, has ordered an inquiry against her close aide VK Sasikala and a doctor. The report also ordered an inquiry against former Health Minister C Vijayabaskar and former Health Secretary Radhakrishnan. Tamil Nadu government tabled the report in the Assembly on Tuesday.

230.title: Got scared: Ankit Tiwari on meeting fan who was threatening to self harm
230.article_body: Singer Ankit Tiwari said he "got scared" when he met his fan who threatened to harm himself if the singer wouldn't meet him. A video of the incident had recently gone viral on social media platforms. Describing the moment as "shocking", Ankit said he spoke to the fan, who later "apologised for creating the ruckus".

231.title: Honda commemorates 25 years of Honda City in India
231.article_body: Honda celebrated the completion of 25 years of Honda City in India, which was launched in 1998 and is currently in its fifth generation avatar. It has remained the longest-running mainstream model in the Indian automotive history, revealed Honda. The vehicle has a cumulative sales of over 9 lakh units in domestic and export markets.

232.title: New foot-over bridge at Khar Road station in Mumbai opens for public
232.article_body: The Western Railway has opened a new foot-over bridge at the Khar Road station of Mumbai Suburban section. The 44-metre-long and six metre wide new foot-over bridge has been opened for public use on the south side of the station. The new foot-over bridge has come up at a cost of ₹4.55 crore, a senior Western Railway's official said.

233.title: 'Kantara' took me back to my roots, had goosebumps: Shilpa Shetty
233.article_body: In an appreciation post for actor-director Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara', actress Shilpa Shetty said that the film took her back to her roots. "What a narrative, emotion, vibe and world. Had goosebumps during the climax," she wrote, adding that 'Kantara' is a must-watch for "the sheer brilliance of storytelling". She also praised Rishab for his conviction and versatility as an artist.

234.title: UP man goes on hunger strike after daughter elopes with boyfriend
234.article_body: A man has been on a hunger strike for the past five days in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor after his 18-year-old daughter eloped with her boyfriend and took ₹3 lakh cash from the house. The girl was supposed to get married to a boy of her parent's choice on October 15. The SHO said that a case has been filed.

235.title: 6 people killed as helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashes
235.article_body: Six people, including two pilots, were killed after a helicopter carrying Kedarnath pilgrims crashed in Uttarakhand, officials have said. The helicopter was carrying pilgrims from Phata, reports said. An administration team has left for the spot for relief and rescue work, reports added.

236.title: Some iPhone 14 users complain of 'SIM not supported' bug, Apple says probing issue
236.article_body: Some Apple users complained about the 'SIM not supported' bug on iPhone 14 recently. As per a memo seen by MacRumors, Apple acknowledged the SIM-related bug in some iPhone 14 devices and stated that after displaying the pop-up message on the screen, the iPhone may entirely freeze. Apple said that while it's investigating the issue, it isn't a hardware problem.

237.title: Ali Fazal shares burning poster of Sajid Khan, says 'evict him from Bigg Boss'
237.article_body: Actor Ali Fazal shared a story on Instagram, appealing that MeToo accused Sajid Khan should be evicted from Bigg Boss 16. He shared a picture showing burning poster of Sajid. This comes amid controversy over Sajid's participation in the show after at least 10 women accused him of sexual harassment and inappropriate behaviour.

238.title: Iran supplying drones to Russia violates UN resolution: US
238.article_body: The US State Department on Monday said that the US agrees with the French and British assessment that Iran's supply of explosive drones to Russia violates UN Security Council Resolution 2231. The resolution, linked to Iran's 2015 nuclear accord, bars Iranian transfers of certain military technologies. Ukraine has reported a spate of Russian attacks using Iranian-made drones in recent weeks.

239.title: Cong condemns AAP's remark against PM's mother, says she is 100 yrs old
239.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel condemned AAP's Gujarat chief Gopal Italia for his remark against PM Modi's mother and said that Heeraben is 100 years old and has nothing to do with politics. He further claimed that AAP is the "B" team of the BJP and they go to Gujarat, Goa and Uttarakhand to defeat the Congress.

240.title: Youths record videos of mismanagement at Bihar hospital, beaten by nurses
240.article_body: Two youths were beaten with sticks by nurses for allegedly recording videos of mismanagement at Chapra District Hospital in the Saran district of Bihar. Reports said that the youths had come to the hospital to collect their medical certificates but started recording videos. Reports added that no police complaint was lodged in the incident.

241.title: Youth creates ruckus at Hyd petrol pump after argument over payment
241.article_body: A youth allegedly created ruckus at a petrol pump in Hyderabad’s Bahadurpura after an argument with an employee over online payment for fuel. The youth called two of his friends and they purportedly ransacked the office and attacked the cashier. Later, one of them took out a gun and moved around. Police reached the spot and arrested one of them.

242.title: Stray dog pulls out one-year-old baby's intestines, bites him to death in Noida
242.article_body: A one-year-old baby died after he was mauled by a stray dog in a housing society in Noida, police said. The baby was admitted to ICU after his intestines were pulled out in the attack. "The parents of the child are construction workers. Both were engaged in construction work inside the society," police added.

243.title: Will suspend driving licence of repeat offenders: Maharashtra Dy CM
243.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has said that the driving licence of people fined more than five to six times for violating traffic norms will now be suspended for a few months. The Maharashtra government has also decided to set up a special squad to monitor vehicles involved in lane jumping along the Mumbai-Pune Expressway.

244.title: Delhi policeman arrested over 'promising' jobs to youths in Punjab Police
244.article_body: Ludhiana Police arrested a Delhi Police constable and booked three others for allegedly cheating youths of lakhs by "promising" them jobs in Punjab Police. The accused allegedly gave a question paper to the victims claiming that a similar one would appear for Punjab Police's constable recruitment written test. The constable had been absent from duty for more than a month.

245.title: Australia reverses recognition of West Jerusalem as capital of Israel
245.article_body: Australia has reversed its recognition of West Jerusalem as the capital of Israel. Foreign Minister Penny Wong said that Australia is committed to a two-state solution, in which Israel and a future Palestinian state co-exist within internationally recognised borders. In 2018, former Australian PM Scott Morrison's government recognised West Jerusalem as Israeli capital.

246.title: Samvardhana Motherson's stock falls to 52-week low after block deal
246.article_body: Auto component firm Samvardhana Motherson's shares fell by 6% on Tuesday's early trade to a 52-week low after 14.6 crore shares reportedly changed hands in multiple trades representing a 4.6% stake worth ₹952 crore. The deal was done at an average of ₹65 per share. At 11:30 am, its stock was trading 6.72% lower at ₹64.55 apiece on NSE.

247.title: 12 trapped amid flooding caused by heavy rainfall rescued in Pune
247.article_body: After heavy rainfall caused waterlogging and flooding incidents in Pune, the fire brigade rescued at least 12 people who were trapped in rain-related incidents. The fire brigade officials said that one person was also injured after a tree fell. Moreover, 30 families from a village were shifted to safer areas as a precautionary measure on Monday, district administration officials said.

248.title: SEBI approves proposed IPOs of 4 companies
248.article_body: SEBI has approved the proposed initial public offerings (IPOs) of four companies, which are BIBA Fashion Limited, Keystone Realtors Limited, Plaza Wires Limited and Hemani Industries Limited. Warburg Pincus and Faering Capital-backed BIBA Fashion had filed the Draft Red Herring Prospectus for an IPO in April. Rustomjee group firm Keystone Realtors filed the preliminary papers for IPO in June.

249.title: Nora Fatehi denied permission to perform by Bangladesh govt to save forex reserves
249.article_body: Bangladesh government has denied dancer and actress Nora Fatehi permission to perform at an event in its capital Dhaka. Fatehi wasn't granted permission "in view of the global situation and with the aim of maintaining the foreign exchange reserves," Bangladesh's Ministry of Cultural Affairs said. She was scheduled to dance and hand out awards at an event.

250.title: GWR officially declares Monday as 'worst day of the week'; Twitter users react
250.article_body: Guinness World Records took to Twitter to officially declare Monday as the "worst day of the week". Reacting to the tweet, users wrote, "Took you long enough," and, "I totally agree." "I take Mondays off just for this reason," and, "That feeling of Sunday evening is much more worst than Monday morning," other users tweeted.

251.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts today and tomorrow
251.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will face power cuts on October 18-19 as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company (BESCOM) and Karnataka Power Transmission Corporation will be undertaking some maintenance works. Most of these outages might occur between 10 am and 4 pm, with some works starting by 9 am. BESCOM divisions which will remain affected today are - Kanakapura, Ramanagara and Tiptur.

252.title: Mom sent me sunscreen but I don't use it: Rahul Gandhi on being told he has tanned
252.article_body: Speaking to Congress workers during the party's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', Rahul Gandhi was told that he has tanned and was asked as to what sunscreen he used. Responding to the workers, Rahul said, "I don't use any sunscreen." When told that "there is some tanning visible", he said, "My mom has sent some (sunscreen), but I am not using it."

253.title: Indian-American appointed to DHS' Faith-Based Security Advisory Council
253.article_body: Indian-American Chandru Acharya was appointed to the Faith-Based Security Advisory Council of the US Department of Homeland Security (DHS) last month. He is the lone Hindu voice in this committee of 25 distinguished faith leaders from the US, a media release said on Monday. Acharya currently serves on the Planning Commission of Canton Township, Michigan.

254.title: Gautam Buddha Nagar to get 2 new private universities
254.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has given its nod for the establishment of two new private universities in the Gautam Buddha Nagar district. The approval for the private JBM Global University and Saroj International University came during a meeting chaired by Chief Secretary DS Mishra in Lucknow. There were proposals for three universities out of which two have been approved.

255.title: Severe waterlogging in parts of Pune due to heavy rain
255.article_body: Severe waterlogging was reported in parts of Pune disrupting traffic movement as heavy rainfall lashed parts of the city on Monday. Some areas which witnessed waterlogging include Swami Vivekanand Marg, Upper Indira Nagar, Mahesh Society Chowk and Bibwewadi. According to IMD's forecast, the rainfall is likely to continue for two more days in the city.

256.title: Punjab MP Simranjit Singh Mann stopped from entering J&K
256.article_body: Punjab MP Simranjit Singh Mann was stopped from entering Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua on Monday on orders of the District Magistrate (DM). The order said that Simranjit's visit may cause a "disturbance in public tranquillity". Simranjit criticised the decision, saying, "I am a Sikh which is the reason that BJP and RSS didn't allow my entry into Jammu and Kashmir."

257.title: Many times UP Police arrests innocent persons: Uttarakhand bureaucrat
257.article_body: UP Police arrests innocent persons many times and claims they are guilty, Uttarakhand Additional Chief Secretary Radha Raturi said. "If you punish an innocent...99 other criminals are born," she added. "Any civil servant should avoid such statements especially when it's related to the matter of the country's biggest and sensitive state," UP's Additional Director General (Law and Order) said.

258.title: Been great 10 years, feel lucky & blessed: Saif on marriage with Kareena
258.article_body: Actor Saif Ali Khan, who recently celebrated a decade of being married to Kareena Kapoor Khan, said that it has been a "great ten years" of his life and he is "very lucky and blessed" for it. Saif shared that he feels he and Kareena are "lucky to have grown together". Saif and Kareena got married on October 16, 2012.

259.title: COVID-19 vaccination drive slows down in Pune
259.article_body: The pace of daily COVID-19 vaccinations has slowed down in Pune. According to the Co-WIN dashboard, weekly vaccinations have decreased from 13,000 to 7,000 in recent weeks. "High-risk populations should complete their vaccination doses as crowding during the festival season could increase the risk of transmission," said a state immunisation officer.

260.title: Action against moonlighting can ruin a person's career: TCS COO
260.article_body: Speaking on the issue of moonlighting, TCS COO N Ganapathy Subramaniam said that it is important to show empathy when dealing with such a matter. He said, "Nothing prevents the country's biggest IT services exporter from taking action against employees for moonlighting when it has evidence…The consequence (of taking action) will be that the person's career will be ruined."

261.title: PM didn’t campaign from Mainpuri out of respect for Mulayam Singh: UP Dy CM
261.article_body: PM Narendra Modi didn't campaign in UP’s Mainpuri in previous two general elections, in 2014 and 2019, out of respect for SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said. "This time lotus will bloom in Mainpuri also," he added. "We all respect ‘netaji’. The PM himself told me that he didn't campaign...for this reason," Maurya added.

262.title: Woman bitten multiple times by pit bull in Delhi; dog owner booked
262.article_body: A case was filed against the owner of a pit bull after the dog allegedly bit a 40-year-old woman multiple times in Delhi's Guru Nanak Dev Colony. The incident occurred in front of the dog owner while the woman was walking. "[The dog] came out of nowhere and attacked me. [The dog owner] couldn't control his pet," the woman claimed.

263.title: Canadian gets 20 yrs in US jail for funding ISIS terrorist activities in Syria
263.article_body: A Canadian national has been sentenced to 20 years in prison in the US for providing money and personnel to Islamic State (ISIS) in Syria, US Justice Department said. Abdullahi Ahmed Abdullahi reportedly helped six Canadian and American nationals to join ISIS in 2013 and 2014, including the first known American to die fighting for the terrorist organisation.

264.title: Priyanka visits drought-hit Kenya, says 'As a new mother, it really hits differently'
264.article_body: Priyanka Chopra took to Instagram to share a video from her visit to drought-hit Kenya. "I am in Kenya with UNICEF to see first hand the severe crisis that is unfolding. And as a new mother, it really hits differently," she said. "Children are starving to death and millions are on the brink of starvation," she added.

265.title: Parle in talks to acquire Polish biscuit maker dr Gerard: Report
265.article_body: Biscuit maker Parle Products is reportedly in talks with private equity firm Bridgepoint to buy Polish cookies and biscuits company, dr Gerard. A report said that the Polish company is currently valued at ₹1,000- ₹1,200 crore. Bridgepoint, which bought dr Gerard in 2013, had appointed investment bank Houlihan Lokey in 2022 to oversee the sale of dr Gerard.

266.title: 13-year-old boy fearing scolding over exam marks runs from school in Maha
266.article_body: A 13-year-old boy ran away from his school after seeing his result in term examinations, reports said, adding that the boy feard being scolded for his result in Maharashtra's Navi Mumbai. He has been traced by police. His parents had filed a complaint after his mother failed to locate him in the school ground. The boy was brought home safely.

267.title: UK PM apologises for economic 'mistakes', says 'I'm sticking around'
267.article_body: UK Prime Minister Liz Truss has apologised for economic "mistakes" which led investors' confidence to dip and her poll ratings to plunge, adding that she won't step down. "I do want to accept responsibility...I'm sticking around because I was elected to deliver for this country," Truss told the BBC. Truss was formally appointed as PM on September 6.

268.title: Stopped theatre visits after people fell at my feet: 'Kantara' director
268.article_body: Actor-director Rishab Shetty said he stopped doing theatre visits after people removed their footwear and fell on his feet post one of the shows of his latest Kannada film 'Kantara'. "I just couldn't handle such reactions as I didn't know how to reciprocate. It made me...emotional and more responsible," he said. The film has grossed over ₹100 crore globally.

269.title: Saw Manmarziyaan promo, was like 'Who is this guy?!': Katrina on husband Vicky
269.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif recalled seeing actor-husband Vicky Kaushal in a promo of 'Manmarziyaan'. "I remember (producer) Aanand L Rai showing me a promo of 'Manmarziyaan' and I was like, 'Who is this guy?!' At that point I just found it...Wow! He was so effortless and raw. He has that talent," she said.

270.title: Credit Suisse plans sale of US asset management arm: Reports
270.article_body: Credit Suisse Group is reportedly considering a sale of its US asset management business and has launched a process for the same. Initial expressions of interest from potential buyers are due by end of this week, however, there's no guarantee of sale and the Swiss bank could ultimately retain the business. This development comes amid the bank facing multiple scandals.

271.title: 'Deepotsav' to begin in Ayodhya from October 21 with Ramlila
271.article_body: The 'Deepotsav' programme in Ayodhya will start from October 21 with Ramlila that will be staged by artists from Russia, Malaysia, Sri Lanka and Fiji. The three-day cultural programme will end on  the eve of Diwali (October 23) with the Ayodhya administration setting a target of lighting 14 lakh diyas at the Ram Ki Paidi ghat on Saryu River.

272.title: 8 people, including constable booked for defrauding police dept of ₹6.83 lakh
272.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Police have booked eight people, including a police constable and the owner of a petrol pump, for defrauding the police department of around ₹6.83 lakh by forging and submitting fake petrol bills. The accused constable, Santosh Mhatre, has been suspended from the force after the incident came to light.

273.title: 31-yr-old female sniper marries soldier she met while fighting Russia in Ukraine
273.article_body: Female Ukrainian sniper Evgeniya Emerald, known as her country's 'Joan of Arc', got married to soldier Evgeniy Stipanyuk she met while fighting Russia. The 31-year-old got married on Friday in a ceremony held in a forest in Kharkiv. A military general officiated the wedding for the couple who got engaged in August, according to reports.

274.title: Wife, 2 minor daughters kill man in TN; burn body & dispose it in forest
274.article_body: Three people were arrested after a 42-year-old man was murdered by his wife, daughters aged 14 and 15 and another youth in Tamil Nadu, reports said. The man's body was burnt and disposed of in a forest. Reports said that the man suspected his wife was having an affair and opposed his elder daughter's affair with a man too.

275.title: Naxals set ablaze vehicles involved in mining work in Chhattisgarh
275.article_body: Naxals set ablaze vehicles involved in mining activities and vandalised two other private vehicles in Chhattisgarh's Kanker on the intervening night of Sunday and Monday, an official said. The Naxals had set fire to the vehicles and escaped after the soldiers posted near the mine noticed them and launched a warning fire, according to the Additional SP.

276.title: Sensex rises over 500 pts, Nifty above 17,450 on positive global cues
276.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the green on Tuesday with the Sensex rising over 500 points at 58,900 and the Nifty above 17,450 on positive global cues. Wipro, Tata Motors, UltraTech Cement, M&M and HUL were among the major gainers on Nifty. The stocks of BPCL and Apollo Hospitals slipped. About 1,433 shares have advanced and 443 shares declined.

277.title: India reports 1,542 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,449
277.article_body: India reported 1,542 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,060 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 26,449. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,913 following eight casualties in the last 24 hours.

278.title: Pat Cummins becomes Australia's new ODI captain
278.article_body: Pat Cummins has been appointed Australia's new ODI captain. The 29-year-old replaces Aaron Finch, who retired from ODI cricket last month. Cricket Australia said that David Warner was not able to be considered for the job as his lifetime leadership ban remains in place. Cummins will be Australia's 27th ODI captain.

279.title: Shoaib Malik shares shirtless pic from gym after Pak lose T20 World Cup warm-up match
279.article_body: Veteran Pakistan all-rounder Shoaib Malik, who has not been included in Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, took to social media to share a shirtless picture of him while working out. "When quitting is not an option," he wrote. His post came after Pakistan lost their T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match against England.

280.title: V-Mart acquires e-commerce platform LimeRoad for ₹31 crore
280.article_body: Fashion retailer V-Mart Retail has acquired the e-commerce platform LimeRoad for a lump sum cash of around ₹31.12 crore. V-Mart said that as part of the acquisition, the company is acquiring assets worth ₹14.61 crore and assuming current liabilities of ₹36.26 crore. Founded in 2012, LimeRoad had raised over $51 million altogether and was backed by investors including Tiger Global.

281.title: Action will be taken against auto, taxi drivers for refusing fares: Mumbai Police
281.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police will take action against auto and taxi drivers who refuse fares, under MVA section 178 (3),1988, the Mumbai Police said. "A meeting will be organised to sensitise the drivers to behave better with citizens and aid in a hassle-free commute. The police officials will be sensitised as well," the Mumbai Police added.

282.title: WhatsApp is far more private & secure than iMessage: Mark Zuckerberg
282.article_body: In a Facebook post, Meta chief Mark Zuckerberg remarked, "WhatsApp is far more private and secure than iMessage, with end-to-end encryption that works across both iPhones and Android, including group chats." Sharing a picture of a Meta ad, he wrote, "With WhatsApp, you can...set all new chats to disappear with the tap of a button...We introduced end-to-end encrypted backups too."

283.title: 2 labourers from UP killed in grenade attack in J&K; terrorist arrested
283.article_body: Two labourers from Uttar Pradesh were killed after terrorists lobbed a hand grenade in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, police said on Tuesday. The deceased, Monish Kumar and Ram Sagar, were shifted to a hospital where they succumbed to their injuries, police added. A hybrid terrorist linked to Lashkar-e-Taiba, who lobbed the grenade, has been arrested, police further said.

284.title: Samantha has put blood & sweat into action scenes: 'Yashoda' producer
284.article_body: 'Yashoda' producer Sivalenka Krishna Prasad said Samantha Ruth Prabhu has put her "sweat and blood into the action scenes" of the film. "Yashoda is a new-age action thriller. Our movie has a balanced quotient of mystery and emotions with gripping elements for audiences. On the whole, it's an edge-of-the-seat thriller," he added. The film will release on November 11, 2022.

285.title: Elgar Parishad-Bhima Koregaon case accused Jyoti Jagtap's bail denied
285.article_body: Bombay High Court on Monday rejected the bail plea of activist Jyoti Jagtap, an accused in the Elgar Parishad-Bhima Koregaon case. "From the seriousness of the conspiracy and the threat that it poses, we are of the considered view...submissions made on behalf of the appellant can't be accepted," HC said. Jagtap was arrested by the NIA in 2020 under UAPA.

286.title: BJP MP Anil Firojiya loses 32 kg after Nitin Gadkari's challenge
286.article_body: Ujjain BJP MP Anil Firojiya has lost almost 32 kg of weight after Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari challenged him. Gadkari promised Firojiya that he would give ₹1,000 crore for development work for each kilo lost. "I met Union Minister Nitin Gadkari and told him and he was very happy to know about it," Firojiya said.

287.title: 108 women freed in first all-female prisoner swap with Russia: Ukraine
287.article_body: Russia has exchanged 108 Ukrainian women held as prisoners of war for 110 Russian captives held by Ukraine, officials on both sides said on Monday. "It was the first all-female exchange," Andriy Yermak, head of the Ukrainian President's staff said, adding that 37 of the women had been captured after Russian forces took the Azovstal steelworks in Mariupol in May.

288.title: If Sisodia is arrested we'll also accompany him to jail: AAP's Sanjay Singh
288.article_body: AAP leader Sanjay Singh, who held a sit-in protest outside CBI office along with other party leaders during Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia’s questioning on Monday, said, "If Sisodia is arrested, then we'll also accompany him to jail." BJP is the party of a group of "corrupt leaders" which is afraid of facing defeat in Gujarat Assembly polls, he added.

289.title: New overbridge in Ghaziabad station set to open for trial run before Diwali
289.article_body: Rail overbridge (ROB) connecting Vijay Nagar to Ghaziabad city, also known as Dhobi Ghat ROB, will open up for a trial run ahead of Diwali festival, officials said. The 153-metre-long new ROB is meant for two-wheelers and light vehicles only. The ROB will reduce travel distance by six to seven kilometres for commuters travelling from Vijay Nagar.

290.title: Baby falls off stands as father tries to save him during Scotland vs WI T20 WC match
290.article_body: A video showing a baby falling off the stands as a man, believed to be his father, tried to save him during a T20 World Cup match between Scotland and West Indies has surfaced online. The man could be seen jumping off the stands to save the baby. Meanwhile, Scotland defeated West Indies by 42 runs.

291.title: Meta India posts 132% surge in net profit at ₹297 crore for FY22
291.article_body: Meta's India unit posted a 132% surge in its net profit at ₹297 crore for the financial year 2021-22 as against ₹128.2 crore a year ago. Its total income grew to ₹2,324 crore, which is a 56.5% surge from ₹1,485.1 crore in the previous fiscal. The gross advertising revenue increased 74% year-on-year to ₹16,189 crore during the said period.

292.title: I tried acting once & was very bad at it, it's a very tough job: Honey Singh
292.article_body: Music producer and singer Yo Yo Honey Singh said that he tried acting once and that he was very bad at it. "I act very badly...I can't act...It's a very tough job. In performing acts, the most difficult is acting, then writing and then comes singing," he said, adding that a new actor should play him in his biopic.

293.title: Kareena plays cop in Hansal Mehta film, wraps first schedule: Report
293.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has reportedly wrapped the first schedule of Hansal Mehta's upcoming untitled directorial in London. Reportedly, Kareena will be seen playing a cop in the film, which is said to be a raw and gritty movie. "Kareena counts it among her most intense roles, and did several workshops before they began filming," a source told Mid-day.

294.title: Pune has received 70% excess rainfall in October so far: IMD
294.article_body: Pune has received 70% excess rainfall in October so far, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said. Pune has witnessed 156.6 mm of rainfall against the normal 55.9 mm, it added. "There has been a sudden increase in the moisture levels over central and western Maharashtra regions, including Pune," an IMD official said. Pune on Sunday recorded 78 mm of rainfall.

295.title: 6 people killed, 19 injured in Russia after warplane hits building
295.article_body: At least six people were killed and 19 others were injured after a Russian warplane crashed into a residential building in Russia's Yeysk town near Ukraine border on Monday after suffering engine failure, Russian news agencies said. Some of the victims died after they jumped from the upper floors of the nine-storey building to escape a massive blaze, authorities said.

296.title: Raids in Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan and Delhi-NCR against terrorists and gangsters
296.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Tuesday conducted raids at more than 40 locations in Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan and Delhi-NCR region. The searches were conducted to dismantle the emerging nexus between terrorists, gangsters and drug smugglers based in India and abroad. The gangsters were reportedly planning to carry out acts of terror.

297.title: Drunk man bites flight attendant's finger, punches him in Istanbul flight; video surfaces
297.article_body: An Istanbul-Jakarta Turkish Airlines flight was forced to make an emergency landing after a drunk passenger got into a fight with flight attendants. The passenger identified as a pilot of different carrier bit a flight attendant's finger. A video showing the passenger punching a flight attendant is being widely circulated on social media.

298.title: SL's Shehan Karunatilaka wins £50,000 Booker Prize for 'The Seven Moons of Maali Almeida'
298.article_body: Sri Lankan author Shehan Karunatilaka won the 2022 Booker Prize for Fiction for his novel 'The Seven Moons of Maali Almeida'. The book centers around the killing of a war photographer in Colombo in the 1990s and explores life after death amid a Sri Lanka beset by civil war. Karunatilaka bagged a prize money of £50,000.

299.title: Pic of Scotland bowler looking at a note while bowling in T20 World Cup 2022 goes viral
299.article_body: A picture of Scotland spinner Mark Watt looking at a note while bowling during his team's T20 World Cup 2022 match against West Indies has gone viral on social media. The 26-year-old, who recorded bowling figures of 4-0-12-3 in his team's victory, later took to Twitter to reveal what was written on the note. "Don't bowl slot," the note read.

300.title: Man dies after he hits speed breaker, falls from bike in Pune
300.article_body: A 46-year-old man died when he fell from his bike after hitting a speed breaker on the Katraj-Dehu Road bypass in Pune. The deceased may have failed to see the speed breaker as it wasn't properly marked, according to police. A sub-inspector said that the deceased suffered head injuries and died on the spot. The incident took place last week.

301.title: Bus crushes B'luru woman's legs as she falls off scooter due to pothole
301.article_body: A 50-year-old woman's legs were crushed by a bus after she fell off a scooter while her daughter, who was driving the vehicle, tried to evade a pothole in Bengaluru. The woman also suffered injuries on her head and abdomen. Reports said that the road was up for repairs but could not be repaired due to heavy rainfall.

302.title: Pic of leopard eel's CT scan shared by US zoo goes viral
302.article_body: Picture of a leopard eel's CT scan which was shared by US' Point Defiance Zoo and Aquarium has gone viral on social media. "Zoo Veterinarian, Dr Kadie, identified a mass in the eel's mouth that was likely due to a broken tooth," the zoo wrote. Reacting to the picture, a social media user said, "I thought it was an art."

303.title: Billionaire Louis Vuitton CEO sells private jet after people track it on Twitter
303.article_body:
Bernard Arnault, the CEO of LVMH and the world's second-richest person, revealed that the luxury-goods company sold their private jet after people set up Twitter accounts tracking their flights.
The 73-year-old billionaire said he has now been renting private jets. Arnault has an estimated net worth of $137 billion, as per the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

304.title: 27-year-old man stabbed to death over argument in Delhi, 2 arrested
304.article_body: Police arrested two men for allegedly stabbing to death a 27-year-old man following a heated argument in Delhi's Chirag Delhi area. The two accused worked as domestic help in south Delhi, and one of the accused was apprehended within five hours, police said. The second accused was arrested at New Delhi Railway Station, police added.

305.title: Woman's naked body found stuffed in suitcase in Gurugram; FIR filed
305.article_body: An FIR has been filed after the naked body of an unidentified woman was found stuffed in a suitcase near IFFCO Chowk in Gurugram on Monday, police said. "A preliminary probe has found that the woman was murdered elsewhere and her body was...dumped here," DCP (West) Deepak Saharan said. He added that efforts are underway to identify the deceased.

306.title: No water supply for 24 hours in parts of Mumbai today
306.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has announced a 24-hour water supply cut in parts of Mumbai today. The water supply will be disconnected from 10 pm on October 17 to 10 pm on October 18. The supply will be hit because of the cross connection work of newly laid 750 mm water main with existing 600 mm dia, BMC said.

307.title: 'Jee Le Zaraa' is super exciting, we're all looking forward to it: Katrina
307.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said her upcoming film 'Jee Le Zaraa' with Priyanka Chopra and Alia Bhatt is a "super exciting film" and they are "all looking forward to it". "That film has had its journey...but I think when finally it does happen, it's gonna be a lot of fun," she added. 'Jee Le Zaraa' was announced in 2021.

308.title: Karim Benzema wins Ballon d'Or for the first time ever
308.article_body: Real Madrid and France forward Karim Benzema won the Ballon d'Or for the first time ever. The 34-year-old scored 44 goals in 46 appearances for Real Madrid last season and won the La Liga and Champions League with the Spanish club. Benzema is the fifth French player to win the Ballon d'Or and the first since Zinedine Zidane in 1998.

309.title: Former Infosys President Ravi Kumar S to join Cognizant to lead its Americas market
309.article_body: Former Infosys President Ravi Kumar S, who resigned from Infosys last week, will join Cognizant on January 16, 2023, as President of Cognizant Americas. He will also be joining Cognizant's executive committee and will be based in New York, as per reports. Kumar has over 20 years of experience in the consulting, process and technology transformation space.

310.title: J&K group protesting Kashmiri Pandit killing remove Hurriyat board
310.article_body: A group protesting against the killing of a Kashmiri Pandit by terrorists removed the signboard of the All Parties Hurriyat Conference at Rajbagh in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian. The protestors also threatened to hold protests outside the Pakistan Embassy in New Delhi. "They (Hurriyat) have been only doing lip service...They should have held protests against these killings," said a protestor.

311.title: Reb Bull in a favourable position for 2023 season: Mercedes F1 boss
311.article_body: Mercedes F1 CEO Toto Wolff said Red Bull will be "in a very favourable position" at the beginning of the 2023 season. "We have missed a lot of development time to find out about bouncing and porpoising...I think we can catch up quickly," said Wolff. "There is no team (in any sport) that is winning every single championship," he added.

312.title: Qatar to host AFC Asian Cup 2023; India, Saudi Arabia shortlisted for 2027
312.article_body: After hosting the 2022 FIFA World Cup, Qatar will host the Asian Cup 2023, said the Asian Football Confederation (AFC). The All India Football Federation and the Saudi Arabian Football Federation have also been selected as the final two bidders for the tournament's 2027 edition. A decision on the same host for 2027 will be taken in February 2023.

313.title: Army issues tenders for 363 high & medium-altitude logistic drones
313.article_body: The Indian Army has issued initial tenders for the procurement of 363 drones to "boost its logistics chain and enhance operational preparedness". While 163 drones would be for high-altitude regions, 200 will be for medium-altitude areas. Medium-altitude drones should be able to carry at least 20 kg of payload, while high-altitude drones should carry 15 kg, the proposal said.

314.title: Bumrah a big loss, Shami seems a good replacement: Sachin Tendulkar
314.article_body: Sachin Tendulkar said Indian pacer Mohammad Shami "seems a good replacement" for the injured Jasprit Bumrah in T20 World Cup 2022. "Bumrah not being there is a big loss and we obviously needed a strike bowler...who could attack batters and get wickets," said Tendulkar. He added a captain should pick spinners during T20 World Cup based on ground dimensions.

315.title: Teams overspending are effectively cheating: McLaren F1 CEO to FIA
315.article_body: McLaren F1 CEO Zak Brown told the FIA that teams that breach the sport’s cost cap are “effectively cheating”. “Bottom line is any team who has overspent has gained an unfair advantage...in the current and following year’s car development,” said Brown. The FIA have found that Red Bull breached the 2021 cost cap set for them.

316.title: Fighter jet crashes into apartment building in southern Russia
316.article_body: A Russian Sukhoi Su-34 crashed into a nine-storey apartment building in the southern Russian city of Yeysk on Monday, the regional governor said. The crash caused a fire in the building that "engulfed several floors at once", the governor of the Krasnodar region added. The fighter jet crashed during a training flight from a military airfield, news agency RIA reported.

317.title: Goal this year to take a catch that could go down as one of my best: Hardik
317.article_body: Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya said that his goal for 2022 is to take a catch that can be considered one of his all-time best. "I am able to spend a lot of time on my fielding with our coach (T Dilip). I was always natural as a fielder, but I want to be exceptional," Pandya said.

318.title: What a year she has had: Navratilova after Swiatek's 8th title of 2022
318.article_body: Eighteen-time Grand Slam champion Martina Navratilova took to Twitter after world number one Iga Swiatek won her eighth title of 2022 and wrote, "What a year Iga has had!!!" The 21-year-old Pole's eight titles this year include two Grand Slams (French Open, US Open), four WTA 1000s (Doha, Indian Wells, Miami, Rome) and two WTA 500s (Stuttgart, San Diego).

319.title: 3 masked men shoot cashier, run away with cash in Rajasthan
319.article_body: Three masked men fired at a bank cashier before robbing him of ₹4 lakh in the Sapotra block of Rajasthan's Karauli district on Monday. The three unidentified accused had come on a bike and were carrying country-made pistols, police said. The bank management has registered a case against the accused who are being identified through CCTV footage, police added.

320.title: CBI denies Sisodia's claims that he was asked to quit AAP for BJP during questioning
320.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Monday issued a statement refusing Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia's allegations that he was asked to leave AAP and join BJP during questioning in the Delhi excise policy scam case. "CBI...reiterates that his examination was carried out in a professional and legal manner," the statement read. Sisodia claimed he was offered Delhi CM's post.

321.title: Pity it took so long for us to play in a World Cup: Zimbabwe captain
321.article_body: Zimbabwe captain Craig Ervine said it is "a pity" that it took "so long" for the team to play in a World Cup match. "To put in a performance like that in the first game back in the World Cup, we showed we belong," said Ervine, after his team defeated Ireland. Zimbabwe last featured in the 2016 T20 World Cup.

322.title: Switch to survival mindset: Suniel Shetty after Byju's fires 2,500 employees
322.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty reacted to Byju's firing 2,500 employees in a cost-cutting measure and said, "[It] was a tough one to swallow." Saying that the layoffs likely affected 10,000 people, Shetty, without naming the company, said, "This is a good time for early-stage...businesses to establish a few operating principles...If you're not seeing growth, switch to a survival mindset."

323.title: Special to be back where it all changed for me: Neeraj at Thank you Tokyo event
323.article_body: After attending the 'Thank you Tokyo!' event, Tokyo Olympics gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra tweeted, "Had a great time at the Tokyo 2020 commemoration ceremony today." "And [it] was a special feeling being back at the stadium where it all changed for me," he added. The event commemorated the successful hosting of the Tokyo 2020 Olympics last year.

324.title: Rahul should stop Bharat Jodo Yatra & concentrate on Himachal, Guj: Cong MP
324.article_body: Congress MP Francisco Sardinha said Rahul Gandhi should stop the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and concentrate on the poll-bound states of Himachal Pradesh and Gujarat. He added that Congress is the "only party" which can defeat the BJP. The 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is very important, said Sardinha, adding that he now wants Rahul 'to stop immediately'.

325.title: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh meets African counterparts
325.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Monday held discussions with his counterparts from Ethiopia, Mauritania, Gambia, Ghana and the Central African Republic ahead of the India-Africa Defence Dialogue which is scheduled for Tuesday. The dialogue will be held on the sidelines of DefExpo 2022 in Gandhinagar, the Defence Ministry said. The first India-Africa Defence Dialogue was held in Lucknow in 2020.

326.title: PVR reports wider than expected Q2 loss at ₹71 crore
326.article_body: Multiplex operator PVR announced that it has reported a bigger-than-expected net loss of ₹71.23 crore for the quarter that ended September. PVR, in its exchange filings, said admissions and average ticket prices suffered due to the weak performance of Bollywood and Hollywood movies. Revenue from operations jumped 470.7% on year to ₹687 crore, but slumped 30% from the previous quarter.

327.title: V-Mart acquires e-commerce startup LimeRoad in a ₹31-crore deal
327.article_body: Fashion retailer V-Mart Retail said it is set to acquire e-commerce startup LimeRoad for lump sum cash of around ₹31.12 crore. The company, in its regulatory filing, said it plans to invest ₹150 crore to scale and achieve sustained profitability. According to the filings, LimeRoad clocked net revenue of ₹179.95 crore in 2019-2020 which dropped to ₹69 crore in 2021-2022.

328.title: T20 has extended life of a professional cricketer: Ex-Aus coach
328.article_body: Former World Cup-winning coach John Buchanan said that the T20 format has extended the life of a cricketer. "I was there for the Legends League Cricket," Buchanan said. The Australian added, "That (veteran leagues) in itself creates more interest on the basis that you can play T20 now for a long period of time and still return [with] reasonable money."

329.title: If Cong gets united, then only India will get united: Mani Shankar Aiyar
329.article_body: Former Union Minister Mani Shankar Aiyar said that if the Congress gets united, then only India will get united. "All these questions, that...who will become the PM, all these can be answered when the right time comes," Aiyar said. He added, "But today, we need to unite the Congress, and... 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' is the first step."

330.title: Piramal Pharma to list shares on October 19
330.article_body: According to a BSE notice, the equity shares of Piramal Pharma Limited shall be listed and admitted to dealings on the exchange in the list of T Group of Securities on October 19. The shares would be listed at a fully paid face value of ₹10 each. Piramal Pharma was demerged from Piramal Enterprises to simplify the company's corporate structure.

331.title: UP govt offers rebate on land stamp duty for setting up new textile units
331.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Minister Rakesh Sachan said under the new Handloom and Textile Industry Policy-2022, entrepreneurs will get a 25% rebate on the purchase of land. The government will also offer up to 100% exemption from stamp duty for setting up a textile unit in the state. The minister said that it aimed at attracting ₹10,000 crore in private investment.

332.title: OFI Global, other funds to sell 5.29 crore equity shares in Zee: Report
332.article_body: OFI Global China Fund and other Invesco-managed funds are reportedly planning to sell 5.29 crore equity shares held in Zee Entertainment Enterprises Ltd. The deal size represents around 5.51 percent of the total shares outstanding in the company. The price for the deal was reported to be in the range of ₹250 to ₹263.7 per share.

333.title: India crash out of 2022 FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup after conceding 16 goals, scoring 0
333.article_body: Hosts India have crashed out of 2022 FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup after conceding 16 goals and scoring 0 in the group stage. India lost to Brazil 0-5 today after having lost to USA 0-8 and to Morocco 0-3. USA and Brazil have advanced to the next stage of the tournament from India's group.

334.title: Mohammad Shami meets Shaheen Afridi, gives him bowling tips; pics go viral
334.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami met Pakistan pacer Shaheen Afridi and gave him bowling tips in Brisbane. Videos and pictures of their interaction has gone viral. In a video, Shaheen can be heard saying, "I'm following you since I started bowling and from that time I've been a big fan of your wrist position and upright seam."

335.title: 21 Indian wrestlers to miss U-23 World Championship after visa rejection by Spain Embassy
335.article_body: The embassy of Spain has denied visas to 21 Indian wrestlers, who were to compete at the U-23 World Championship in Pontevedra, on suspicion that they will not leave the territory before the expiry of visas. The Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) had picked a 30-member squad for the Championship, that began on Monday, but only nine were granted visas.

336.title: Replacing 'phone banking' with 'digital banking' promoted growth: PM
336.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said India's sustained economic growth has been possible due to the BJP government's efforts to replace pre-2014 'phone banking' with 'digital banking'. Under 'phone banking', instructions were given to banks on phones, PM Modi said. Any country's economy is as progressive as its banking sector's strength, he added.

337.title: Germany starts programme to take in Afghans deemed most at-risk
337.article_body: The German government on Monday launched a programme to take in Afghan citizens who are considered to be at a high risk of facing persecution under Taliban rule. Under the programme, 1,000 Afghans and their family members will be admitted to Germany every month. The programme targets individuals associated with women's and human rights advocacy, politics, justice and other fields.

338.title: Roche Pharma sets up data analytics center in Hyderabad, 2nd in India
338.article_body: Swiss multinational healthcare company Roche Pharma has set up a state-of-the-art Global Analytics and Technology Centre of Excellence (GATE) in Hyderabad. The centre, reportedly India's second, will work with the global affiliates of Roche to advance knowledge and understanding of the healthcare space. Meanwhile, Telangana Minister KTR said, "I'm delighted to welcome Roche Pharma to Hyderabad."

339.title: Who is Abdul Kardar, the new inductee in PCB Hall of Fame who has played for India too?
339.article_body: Abdul Hafeez Kardar has been inducted into Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Hall of Fame. He's Pakistan's first-ever captain. He was born in Lahore on January 17, 1925 and made his Test debut for India in 1946. He played three Tests for India, scoring 80 runs. After Partition, he represented Pakistan in 23 Tests, scoring 847 runs and taking 21 wickets.

340.title: Man kills sleeping stray dog by hitting brick on its head in UP, video surfaces
340.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a man killing a sleeping stray dog by hitting a brick on its head in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur. The Uttar Pradesh Police took cognisance of the viral video and arrested the accused for animal cruelty. "This kind of inhuman act is unforgivable," the police said.

341.title: Fake CBI began 'raids' on Mumbai businessmen during demonetisation
341.article_body: Goregaon Police said the gang posing as CBI officers to rob businessmen began their racket during demonetisation. They would collect information on those who wanted their money converted and "raid" them. Police said they are looking into more victims after one businessman recently came forward about being kidnapped and robbed of ₹50 lakh by the gang in July.

342.title: Govt school teacher suspended for sexually abusing student in Assam
342.article_body: A government school teacher was suspended for allegedly sexually abusing a student on the premises of the institute in Assam's Kamrup district, an official said on Monday. A police case has been registered against the accused, the official added. A show cause notice was served to the teacher by Kamrup Inspector of Schools Apurba Thakuria on October 14.

343.title: Once you get used to Australian conditions, you can get lot of runs: Hardik
343.article_body: Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya said that he was always excited to come to Australia and get so much time to prepare for the T20 World Cup. "In Australia, it's about one inning. If you can get the inning early in the season, once you get used to the conditions, you can score a lot of runs," Pandya said.

344.title: US woman saves for 30 years to fund her ₹2 cr trip to see the Titanic's wreckage
344.article_body: An American woman named Renata Rojas saved money for over 30 years to fund her trip to see the wreckage of the Titanic ship which sank in 1912. Renata spent $250,000 (around ₹2 crore) for the trip to the bottom of the North Atlantic Ocean to see the remains of the ship which sank 110 years ago.

345.title: Samantha Ruth Prabhu's 'Yashoda' to release on November 11
345.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu on Monday announced the release date of her movie 'Yashoda'. The film will be released on November 11. It will arrive in theatres in multiple languages, including Telugu, Tamil, Malayalam, Kannada and Hindi. 'Yashoda' has been directed by Haresh Narayan and K Hari Shankar.

346.title: No Kejriwal to tutor Sisodia during CBI questioning: Amit Malviya
346.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya said Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia needs to be reminded that "he has been summoned for corruption and is not going for Satyagrah". Malviya added that Sisodia has to face the CBI alone and "there will be no Kejriwal to tutor" him. He said Rahul Gandhi too had thrown "similar tantrums" but still recorded his statements.

347.title: You gave me company when I faced a tough time as child: Arjun to Sanjay Kapoor
347.article_body: Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram on Monday to wish his uncle Sanjay Kapoor on the occasion of his birthday. In a video message, Arjun said, "You've given me company when I faced a tough time as...child." "I...want to thank you from the bottom of my heart, for being such a positive person, who's so full of life," he added.

348.title: Germany fines Telegram $5 mn for not establishing way to report content
348.article_body: Telegram has been fined $5 million by Germany for not establishing a lawful way for reporting illegal content and not naming an entity in Germany to receive official communication. Officials said they've repeatedly failed in their attempts to serve papers to Dubai-based Telegram, despite support from UAE authorities. Telegram is becoming "medium for radicalisation", German police had said earlier.

349.title: Fill up 14 lakh vacant posts in govt depts, PSUs: CPI to Centre
349.article_body: The Communist Party of India has demanded that the Centre immediately fill about 14 lakh vacant posts in the Central government departments and the public sector undertakings. In a resolution passed at its 24th national congress at Vijayawada on Monday, the CPI alleged that over two crore youths of the country are unemployed and seeking jobs.

350.title: Govt to invite proposals under second phase of PLI scheme for solar sector
350.article_body: New & Renewable Energy Secretary Indu Shekhar Chaturvedi said government will invite proposals under second phase of ₹19,500-crore production linked incentive (PLI-II) scheme for solar sector within a week. Chaturvedi added that by 2026, India is looking at the capacities of 38 GW in Polysilicons, 56 GW in Ingot and Wafers, 70-80 GW in cells and 90-100 GW in modules.

351.title: We need to wake up: WI head coach Simmons on team's loss vs Scotland
