351.article_body: West Indies head coach Phil Simmons said his side's batting was "a bit unprofessional" in their 42-run defeat against Scotland in T20 World Cup 2022. "We need to wake up...start being as professional as we can be," he added. Chasing 161, West Indies were bowled out for 118 in 18.3 overs as only four of their batters reached double digits.

352.title: Indian cyclist Ronaldo creates national record in 200m flying time trial
352.article_body: Indian cyclist Ronaldo Singh Laitonjam created a new national record in men's 200m flying time trial category in the recently concluded Cycling Track World Championships 2022 in France. He clocked 9.91 seconds in the men's sprint qualifying round. Finishing at the 31st place, Ronaldo couldn't qualify as only the top 28 made it to the next round.

353.title: Was asked to leave AAP: Delhi Deputy CM Sisodia after 9-hour CBI questioning
353.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, who was questioned by CBI in Delhi excise policy scam case for nearly nine hours on Monday, said, "I was asked to leave AAP or else such cases will keep getting registered against me." He added, "I said I won't leave AAP for BJP." Sisodia alleged he was told that he'll be made the CM.

354.title: Beauty: Anushka on Kohli's 1-handed catch vs Aus in T20 WC warm-up match
354.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma took to Instagram Stories and reacted to her husband and cricketer Virat Kohli taking a one-handed catch versus Australia during the T20 World Cup warm-up match. Sharing the video of the catch, the actress wrote, "Beauty!" Australia lost by six runs in the warm-up match after India took four wickets in the last four deliveries.

355.title: EU approves training mission for Ukrainian soldiers
355.article_body: The European Union (EU) on Monday approved a military assistance mission to train 15,000 Ukrainian soldiers in the wake of the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. The mission will initially run for two years with a budget of almost $104 million, the Associated Press reported. The bloc also approved military aid worth $486 million for the purchase of weapons by Kyiv.

356.title: Cement maker ACC posts loss of ₹91 crore in Q3; sales grow 7%
356.article_body: Cement manufacturer ACC has reported a standalone loss of ₹91 crore for the quarter ended September 2022. The company recorded a 7% rise in net sales at ₹3,910 crore as compared to ₹3,653 crore it reported in the same quarter last year. Notably, Gautam Adani-led Adani Group has recently acquired ACC along with Ambuja Cements from Switzerland's Holcim.

357.title: Gavaskar gifts Babar 'Sunny' cap at dinner party hosted by Hayden, PCB shares video
357.article_body: The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) shared a video showing Sunil Gavaskar meeting Pakistan captain Babar Azam at a dinner party hosted by Pakistan's batting mentor Matthew Hayden at his house in Brisbane. In the video, Gavaskar can be seen presenting 'Sunny' cap to Babar. He can also be seen signing the cap for Babar.

358.title: Katrina Kaif to play double role in 'Phone Bhoot': Reports
358.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif will reportedly be seen in a double role in the upcoming film 'Phone Bhoot'. Directed by Gurmmeet Singh, it is a horror-comedy film which will also feature Ishaan Khatter, Siddhant Chaturvedi, Jackie Shroff and Sheeba Chadha, among others. 'Phone Bhoot' is set to release in theatres on November 4.

359.title: 2 UN peacekeepers killed, 4 injured in IED blast in Mali
359.article_body: Two UN peacekeepers were killed and four were seriously injured when their vehicle hit an IED in northern Mali on Monday, UN peacekeeping mission MINUSMA said. The peacekeepers were on a mine detection patrol in the Kidal region when the incident occurred, MINUSMA added. Northern Mali has a strong presence of militant groups linked to al-Qaeda and the Islamic State.

360.title: Video of Babar, Kohli practising in parallel nets in Brisbane goes viral
360.article_body: A video of Pakistan captain Babar Azam and former India captain Virat Kohli practising in parallel nets in Brisbane ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 has gone viral. Kohli went straight into the nets after India's victory against Australia in their warm-up match. Kohli scored 19 runs off 13 deliveries in the match, including a four and a six.

361.title: Tina Datta was trying to backstab me on 'Bigg Boss 16': Sreejita De
361.article_body: 'Bigg Boss 16' contestant Sreejita De, who became the first contestant to be evicted from the show, has said that co-contestant and actress Tina Datta was trying to backstab her on the show. "Now that I'm out, I get to see that she...was trying to manipulate her friends against me...She was talking bad about me behind my back," Sreejita added.

362.title: Liverpool pledge to impose life ban on fans who threw coins at Guardiola
362.article_body: Liverpool FC have pledged to impose life ban on the club's supporters found guilty of throwing coins towards Pep Guardiola during Sunday's Premier League match against Manchester City at Anfield. "This is totally unacceptable behaviour and not the standards of behaviour we expect at Anfield," said a club spokesman. Guardiola had said he did not get hit by the coins.

363.title: Deepika in talks to star in Rajamouli's next film with Mahesh Babu: Reports
363.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone is reportedly in talks to play the female lead in filmmaker SS Rajamouli's next film, which will feature Mahesh Babu as the male lead. The yet-untitled film will reportedly go on the floors in the first half of 2023. Deepika will also be seen in 'Pathaan', 'Fighter', 'Project K' and 'The Intern'.

364.title: Karnataka High Court stays counselling for NEET PG 2022
364.article_body: The Karnataka High Court on Monday stayed the counselling process for NEET Postgraduate Entrance Test (PGET) 2022 till further notice. Details about the commencement of the Karnataka counselling will be announced soon and the Karnataka High Court will hear the matter now on October 30. Registrations for the counselling began on October 14.

365.title: Hrithik delayed 'Vikram Vedha' shoot for me due to 'Mismatched 2': Rohit Saraf
365.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' actor Rohit Saraf said Hrithik Roshan intervened after the shoot dates of the film and Rohit's web series 'Mismatched 2' were clashing. He added 'Mismatched' director Akarsh Khurana adjusted shoot dates after a talk with Hrithik. "But...Hrithik understood we couldn't cancel...schedule of 'Mismatched'...entire schedule of 'Vikram Vedha' got pushed by five days," Rohit stated.

366.title: 11 convicts in Bilkis Bano case granted bail for good behaviour: Guj govt to SC
366.article_body: The 11 men convicted in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case were released on grounds of "good behaviour", the Gujarat government told the Supreme Court on Monday. The state government has filed an affidavit defending its decision to grant remission to the convicts, who were sentenced to life imprisonment. Bilkis' three-year-old daughter was among 14 killed by a mob in 2002.

367.title: Bitterly disappointed: Balbirnie after Ireland's loss vs Zimbabwe in T20 WC
367.article_body: Ireland skipper Andy Balbirnie said his side is "bitterly disappointed" with the way they started their T20 World Cup 2022 campaign after losing to Zimbabwe by 31 runs in Group B match on Monday. "It's a pretty straightforward shoot-out for us now," he added. Chasing a target of 175 runs, Ireland managed to score 143/9 in 20 overs.

368.title: Qatar World Cup ticket sales near 3 million mark: FIFA President
368.article_body: FIFA President Gianni Infantino said that 2.89 million tickets have been sold up till now for the upcoming football World Cup in Qatar and the figure is soon likely to touch the three million mark. Almost 240,000 hospitality packages had been sold for the tournament, Infantino said. The top three purchasing countries are Qatar, the United States and Saudi Arabia.

369.title: Wild bear sighted near T'gana university campus, search op underway
369.article_body: Telangana Forest Department officials have started a search operation to locate a wild bear that was reportedly sighted near the men's hostel of Satavahana University in Telangana's Karimnagar on Sunday night. Meanwhile, students have reportedly been asked not to venture out in the evenings. The campus security guards who keep vigil at night have been asked to move in groups.

370.title: India's retail inflation set to ease from 5-month high in September: RBI
370.article_body: The RBI, in its monthly bulletin, said that retail inflation is set to ease after it hit a five-month high in September. RBI added that the fight against inflation will be "dogged and prolonged", given the long and variable lags of monetary policies. It said the expected easing in inflation would likely be "driven by the food and beverages".

371.title: Flights rescheduled as Mumbai airport to remain closed between 11 am & 5 pm tomorrow
371.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport will be closed between 11 am and 5 pm on Tuesday due to annual repair and maintenance work on both its runways. The airport has rescheduled flights accordingly. Major work like runway edge lights and the upgradation of Aeronautical ground lights will be carried out during this time period.

372.title: Raza played exceptionally well: Ervine on Zimbabwe's win vs Ireland in T20 WC
372.article_body: Zimbabwe skipper Craig Ervine lauded Sikandar Raza, saying his teammate played exceptionally well against Ireland in T20 World Cup 2022 Group B match. "He's been a solid performer for us over the last few months. So excited that he could bring that form here again," he added. Raza was adjudged 'Player of the Match' in Zimbabwe's 31-run win.

373.title: Apple's VR headset to let users log in, make payments biometrically: Report
373.article_body: Apple's virtual reality XR headset will include sensors that work like Face ID and offer iris-scanning technology, according to reports. The new technology, called 'Iris ID', would enable users to log in to their accounts and make payments biometrically. The headset reportedly has over 10 cameras and might be powered by M2 chip, same as that used in MacBook Air.

374.title: RBI fines 3 Gujarat-based cooperative banks for rule violations
374.article_body: RBI has fined three Gujarat-based banks for violating regulatory norms. RBI has reportedly imposed a monetary penalty of ₹25,000 on Meghraj Nagarik Sahakari Bank, ₹50,000 on Gandhidham Mercantile Co-operative Bank and ₹2 lakh on Co-operative Bank of Rajkot. The banks had individually sanctioned loans, wherein directors' relatives stood as surety or guarantors, violating RBI's regulatory norms.

375.title: Makers share pic from 'Pushpa 2' sets, Rashmika Mandanna reacts
375.article_body: Mythri Movie Makers, the producers of Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna's 'Pushpa' franchise, shared a picture from the sets of 'Pushpa: The Rule' on Twitter. Along with the picture, they tweeted, "Icon star Allu, director Sukumar, celebrity photographer Avinash Gowariker...the entire team is putting all their efforts to deliver the best." Rashmika tweeted, "Look at that! It's starting y'all."

376.title: Hacker who stole $100 mn from DeFi app Mango gets to keep $50 mn
376.article_body: A hacker who stole about $100 million from decentralised-finance (DeFi) application Mango got to keep around $50 million of the funds in various crypto assets after returning the rest on Saturday. The hacker had demanded erasure of bad debts. Mango's team then offered to let the hacker keep $50 million while promising no criminal prosecution and erasure of bad debt.

377.title: Beating Magnus Carlsen is special, but not very proud of that game: 16-year-old Gukesh D
377.article_body: After 16-year-old Grandmaster Gukesh D became the youngest chess player to defeat Magnus Carlsen after the latter became world champion, Gukesh said, "Beating Magnus is always special...but I am not very proud of that game." Carlsen said, "Gukesh has been extremely impressive in classical chess...Perhaps this rapid win wasn't his proudest effort, even though getting a win is always nice."

378.title: 4 more terror suspects with links to al-Qaeda arrested in Assam
378.article_body: Assam Police on Monday arrested four persons with alleged links to Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT), a Bangladesh-based terror outfit affiliated with al-Qaeda in the Indian Subcontinent. CM Himanta Biswa Sarma, announcing the arrests, said, "We're determined to root out jihadi elements from Assam." "Arrest of Sadeq Ali is a significant achievement since he had been radicalising youth," he added.

379.title: Journalist who protested Ukraine war on live TV flees Russia
379.article_body: Former Russian state TV journalist Marina Ovsyannikova, who was placed under house arrest for spreading "fake news" about the war in Ukraine, has fled the country, her lawyer said on Monday. Ovsyannikova announced her escape from house arrest in an online post on October 5. She had staged an on-air protest against Russia's invasion of Ukraine in March.

380.title: Afghan woman kills self before Taliban could stone her for eloping with married man
380.article_body: An Afghan woman, who was to be stoned to death by the Taliban for running away with a married man, died by suicide to reportedly avoid public humiliation, local media said. The man she ran away with was reportedly executed on Thursday. The woman was sentenced to be publicly stoned due to the lack of women's prisons, said a report.

381.title: Vegetable seller objects to man drinking alcohol in Agra, stabbed
381.article_body: A 32-year-old vegetable vendor was stabbed to death in Agra after he objected to a man drinking alcohol near his cart, police said on Monday. The 26-year-old accused took a sharp object from the cart and stabbed the vendor in his chest on Sunday, police said. The victim was taken to the hospital but was declared dead later, police added.

382.title: Trolls, where are you all slowly vanishing, don't leave me: Raj Kundra
382.article_body: Shilpa Shetty's husband Raj Kundra tweeted, "Trolls, where are you all slowly vanishing, please don't leave me." Recently, Raj completed one year of being released from jail in connection with the alleged creation and uploading of porn films on apps. Several Twitter users reacted to Raj's post. One of the users wrote, "This tweet is also going to be deleted."

383.title: Politician Shrikant Tyagi, who abused & assaulted Noida woman, gets bail
383.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has granted bail to politician Shrikant Tyagi, who assaulted a woman at a Noida residential society in August. Tyagi was granted bail in some cases but remained in jail. Among other cases, he was booked under the Gangster Act after a group of his supporters stormed the society and sought the woman complainant's address.

384.title: A small film is breaking records of biggies: RGV on 'Kantara'
384.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to praise Rishab Shetty's film 'Kantara'. "Just when all filmwallas came to the conclusion that only superstars, massive production values and spectacular VFX can bring people to theatres, a small tiny film with no names, #Kantara is breaking all...records of the biggies," he wrote. The film has collected over ₹100 crore globally.

385.title: Suryakumar is very different from Kohli and Karthik: Gambhir
385.article_body: Speaking about Suryakumar Yadav, Gautam Gambhir stated that the Team India batter is very different from teammates Virat Kohli and Dinesh Karthik. "He (Suryakumar) is extremely unorthodox, plays shots over fine leg, third man, cover...Karthik...improvises a lot...Kohli likes to take his time while batting," he added. Suryakumar scored a 33-ball 50 against Australia in T20 World Cup warm-up match.

386.title: Kerala human sacrifice accused may have used mortuary experience: Police
386.article_body: The key accused of torturing and killing two women as 'human sacrifice' in Kerala may have used his mortuary experience to cut the bodies, police said. The accused had worked as a helper at the post-mortem table around 20 years ago. The women were killed on different days between June and September.

387.title: Deeply concerning: UK on attack on protester at Chinese consulate
387.article_body: The British PM's office on Monday said the reports of an apparent assault on a protester inside the grounds of the Chinese consulate in Manchester were "deeply concerning". The protester was seemingly dragged into the consular grounds and assaulted by several men, according to a video shared online. The incident occurred during a demonstration against Chinese President Xi Jinping.

388.title: Ladakh administration gifts cricket kit to young Virat Kohli fan after her video goes viral
388.article_body: The Ladakh administration gifted a cricket kit to a Class 6 girl named Masuma Banoo from Kaksar Kargil after her video playing cricket went viral on social media. In the video, the girl had stated that Virat Kohli is her favourite cricketer and she wants to bat like him. The administration also shared a video wherein Masuma expressed her gratitude.

389.title: She is & will always be the most beautiful actress: Bhansali on Hema Malini
389.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali said in an interview that he is a huge fan of Hema Malini, adding that she is and will always be "the most beautiful actress ever". "[Earlier] movies were bought by distributors solely because of her presence," he said. "It didn't matter who the hero was if Hemaji was in a film," Bhansali further said.

390.title: Salman Khan, Anil Kapoor & Fardeen Khan's 'No Entry 2' shelved: Reports
390.article_body: Salman Khan-starrer 'No Entry 2' has reportedly been shelved over legal and financial issues. According to a source, the plan was to pay off everyone and acquire the rights to the 2005 film, which was produced by now-closed Sahara One Motion Pictures. However, the amount has reportedly exceeded the budget. "Circumstances are such that nothing is materializing," the source added.

391.title: Woman fights robbers, foils robbery attempt in Raj; video surfaces
391.article_body: In a video that has now gone viral, a female Gramin Bank employee can be seen fighting robbers and thwarting a robbery bid in Rajasthan's Sri Ganganagar area. The robber allegedly barged into the bank with a knife and threatened the officials. In the video, the woman can be seen picking up an electrical instrument to fight the robbers.

392.title: Justice DY Chandrachud appointed Chief Justice of India from November 9 onward
392.article_body: Justice DY Chandrachud was on Monday appointed the 50th Chief Justice of India (CJI) by President Droupadi Murmu, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said. Chandrachud, a law graduate from Delhi University, will take oath on November 9. The current Justice UU Lalit, who is due to retire on November 8, recommended Chandrachud as his successor last week.

393.title: 5 including 4 of Haryana family dead, 3 hurt in car-truck collision
393.article_body: Four members of a family died after the car they were travelling in collided head-on with a truck coming from the opposite direction in Haryana's Hisar district, police said on Monday. Because of the collision, two motorcycles were also hit and one of the riders died, police added. At least three persons sustained injuries in the accident.

394.title: MP doctor writes prescription in Hindi with 'Shri Hari', pics surface
394.article_body: A prescription written in Hindi by a government doctor in Madhya Pradesh has surfaced on social media. The doctor, Sarvesh Singh, also wrote 'Shri Hari' on the top of the prescription. This comes after Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that doctors could perhaps start writing prescriptions in Hindi with 'Shri Hari' on top.

395.title: Without late director Nishikant, Drishyam 2 wasn't possible: Ajay Devgn
395.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn remembered late director Nishikant Kamat, who had directed 'Drishyam', at the trailer launch event of 'Drishyam 2'. "I want to just take this occasion to remember Nishi, who directed the first part. Without him, this wasn't possible," he stated. Nishikant, who was diagnosed with cirrhosis, passed away aged 50 in 2020.

396.title: AAP 'glorifying' corruption, says BJP after Sisodia's 'roadshow'
396.article_body: BJP on Monday accused AAP of "glorifying corruption", alleging that Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia held a roadshow despite being complicit in the excise policy scam. BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said he was hurt when he saw Sisodia being garlanded and being taken to Rajghat in an open car. AAP converting a vice into a victory, Patra said.

397.title: 3 J'khand teenagers die, another hurt as portion of land caves in
397.article_body: Three teenagers died after a portion of land caved in when they were extracting soil for painting their hut's walls for Diwali in Jharkhand's Chatra district, police said. Four teenagers, who were left buried after the incident, were retrieved with the help of villagers and an excavator. They were rushed to a health sub-centre, where three of them died.

398.title: Here to be serious actress, not girl who only does dance numbers: AvrRam
398.article_body: Actress Elli AvrRam, speaking about being an outsider and a foreigner in the film industry, said she's in a "constant struggle" to prove she's a serious actress, not the girl who only does dance numbers. "But I'm happy where I'm today and I'm really grateful to all the people who gave me an opportunity to showcase my talent," she added.

399.title: You'll not see this sort of batting in every game: Gambhir on KL Rahul's 57
399.article_body: Praising KL Rahul following his 33-ball 57 in India's T20 World Cup 2022 warm-up match against Australia, Gautam Gambhir said, "You will not see this sort of batting in every match." He added that Rahul, who hit six fours and three sixes during his knock, was seen in "exceptional" rhythm. India won the match by six runs.

400.title: Delhi LG issues notice to DDC VC Jasmine Shah over misuse of public office
400.article_body: Delhi LG VK Saxena on Monday issued a show cause notice to Dialogue and Development Commission's Vice Chairperson Jasmine Shah over allegations of "misuse of public office". The notice has been sent following a complaint by BJP MP Parvesh Sahib Singh. "Shah...acted as official spokesperson of AAP for political gains, which is in violation of established procedures," LG's notice read.
